loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is widowed and works hard to support her family. Carmelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Carmelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Chona has been in this business for 10 years now.

Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cecilia Ines

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 60 años de edad que trabaja en una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, ella inicio el negocio para ayudar a su marido en los gastos de la familia, tales como alimentación, pago de servicios públicos entre otros, un negocio que no solo ha mejorado la parte económica de su hogar si no que ha sido también muy nutritiva en su formación personal pues tiene una edad avanzada y las relaciones y el continuo contacto con las personas le enriquece el alma y la hace sentir útil, algo muy valioso que le ha servido para superar enfermedades y algunos caso de depresión que tenia.

Cecilia se siente muy contenta y motivada ya que su negocio cada vez está marchando mejor y ahora quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido y ampliar su inventario para poder cubrir la demanda actual.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 60 year old woman who works in a shop selling everyday household goods. She started the business in order to help her husband with the household costs, such as food and paying for public services amongst other things.  

It's a business that has not only improved her household finances but it has also been very important in her personal development.  

She is of an advanced age and her relationships and continuous contact with people enrich her life and make her feel useful. This is very important to her and has helped her to overcome illness and in some cases depression. 

Cecilia feels very happy and motivated as her business continues to improve.  Now she wants to apply for a loan in order to buy stock and widen her inventory so that she can deal with current demand.

loans.use: to buy everyday household goods in bulk.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
The gentleman in the photograph is Moses, 43 years old, married and blessed with four children. 

His economic activity is vegetable farming. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July, 2013. He has received training on enterprise development and financial planning that has equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise.
 
He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to expand his vegetable farming. He hopes the loan will help him boost his business and hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to support his family by providing basic needs such as food. 

Moses is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support, and he promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer that will help boost farming yield to produce more income.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is a 59-year-old woman from a remote area of Siem Reap Province. She is the mother of two children. To make a living, Lay raises pigs for sale, earning, on average, an income of US$3 a day.  She has been involved in this type of business for five years. 

Lay would like to improve her standard of living by having clean energy for household use. Due to her lack of capital, she is requesting a loan to build a biogas digester under the National Biogas Program (NBP) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t have to spend as much money on fuel and will lessen the amount of smoke produced by wood or charcoal. 

Lay is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered her a special interest rate. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input to enable high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of maize for sale in the market to gain more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail stocks for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school. Babylyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

Babylyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Babylyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Felma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. 

Felma is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
José es un hombre trabajador, honrado, una persona que quiere tener un mejor futuro, situado en las zonas rurales donde los agricultores y criadores de animales salen adelante, allí esta José entre ellos, pero no como un agricultor él se dedico a tener otras clases de servicios pues debido a un problema de salud no puede ejercer la actividad que sus ancestros han realizado.

José se dedica a alquilar videojuegos, tiene una sala de juegos, donde las personas que no tiene recursos para comprar una consola se gozan una hora de su tiempo divirtiéndose sanamente.


José quiere mejorar su negocio, reparar las consolas, sus clientes se quejan del estado de los controles y que ciertas películas no cargan en la consola y en vista de las numerosas quejas quiere solicitar un préstamo para poder reparar las consolas de videojuegos y realizar una reforma locativa, colocar cerámica, ventanas, sillas, pintura entre otros.
texts.en:
José is an honorable, hardworking man who wants to obtain a better future. He lives in a rural area, where farmers and cattle owners make their living. José is one of them, but he does not a farmer. He works offering other services. Due to some health concerns, he is not able to work as a farmer like his ancestors all did.

José earns a living renting video games. He has a game room where people with scarce resources who cannot afford to buy a console can enjoy an hour of healthy fun.

José wants to improve his business and repair his consoles. His customers complain about the state of the controllers and how certain movies will not load in the consoles, among other numerous complaints. José is requesting this loan in order to repair his video game consoles and improve the conditions of his business: he will add ceramics, windows, chairs, paintings and other items.

loans.use: to repair video game consoles and improve his business.

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en: Sopheap is a young woman who lives in Kraties province’s Prey Prosorb district. She is 19-years-old and has one small kid. Nowadays, she does rice farming and fish catching to earn extra income for the past eight years. She could make an income around 20,000 KHR per day from her business income. This is the first loan for Sopheap with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Through this loan, she will use it to pay for labor fees in plowing her farmland. Sopheap expects that this loan will enable her to timely grow her rice to better her living conditions and send her kid to school.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past 35 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials such as gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Geraldine dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, a 64-year-old married woman, lives in the Oni district. She has a husband and son, who are temporarily unemployed. To take care of her family's increased needs, Tamar engages in the cultivation of vineyard and nut trees. She realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Tamar's husband helps her greatly in his everyday activities related to the agribusiness. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Tamar has a  great desire to start dairy farming and seeks credit among local financial institutions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poors to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,300 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 

The loan will greatly assist Tamar, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Tamar has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To start dairy farming and sell milk-products

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 43-years-old and works hard to help her husband. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rizza requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to invest in a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Rizza is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloths for sewing.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une mère de 41 ans, de quatre enfants âgés de 3 à 15 ans. Son mari travaille comme transitaire. Akossiwa revend de divers produits tels que le maïs, les haricots secs, le charbon de bois, et de gari      (farine de manioc). Elle est à la demande de son second crédit pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Elle prévoit d'utiliser l'argent pour augmenter son stock de marchandises. Elle espère poursuivre la croissance de son entreprise à l'avenir, et utiliser le produit pour assurer l'avenir de sa famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 41-year old mother of four children, aged between three and 15 years old. Her husband works as a freight forwarding agent. Akossiwa retails a variety of products, such as corn, dried beans, charcoal and gari (cassava flour). She is requesting her second loan to get fresh supplies. She plans to use the money to increase her stock. In the future she hopes to be able to expand her business and use the profit to provide for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and farm inputs for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Droste

texts.en:
Droste is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Droste is 35 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Droste has a repair business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Droste has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 59 years old. He is married with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 23.  They all go to school. 

He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is a business woman. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvest his maize. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay his children's school fees and medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvest his maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops which will increase the nutrients in the soil and produce a better harvest.

loans.name: Rocio Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rocio es una empresaria que está luchando y trabajando con mucho empeño para pagar la universidad de su hijo, ella se dedica a vender alimentos como lo son frutas y vegetales, una actividad con altos y bajos debidos al aumento significativo del precio de los productos pro diferentes factores como lo son paro de los transportadores e incluso fuertes lluvias y sequias que afectan los cultivos, pero aún así esta mujer sigue peleándose su sustento familiar y el de su hija y tiene la fe de que las cosas mejoraran y que venderá mucho más para poder enviar a su hijo a estudiar en una institución universitaria.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos como lo son papas, papa criolla, plátanos, tomates, cebolla, zanahoria, limones, alverjas, ahuyama entre otros, buscando mejorar el surtido y tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocio is a businesswoman who is struggling and working with much effort to pay her son's university. She works selling food such as fruits and vegetables. This business has it's ups and downs due to the significant increase in prices of products due to different factors such as transportation strikes and heavy rains and droughts that affect the crops. Even so she is a woman who continues to struggle for the daily sustenance for her family and her daughter. She has faith that things will get better and she sells much more so she is able to end her daughter to study in a university.

She is requesting a loan to buy products like potatoes, native potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrot, limes, peas and buttercup squash amongst others. She is looking to improving her variety and have products of quality to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy products like potatoes, native potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, onion, carrot, limes, peas and buttercup squash amongst others.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 51 years old. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 14 and 26. Three of them go to school. 

He has farmed for 7 years. With this Kiva loan, he would like to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay his children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a cooling tank and milk to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia Esther se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Esther continues with her business of selling food.  She is an enterprising woman.  Through this business she wants her children to complete their education.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her established payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machinery to start her business making cement blocks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old.  He is married to Kemunto and supports 6 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 13 years and the business earns him 11,000 KES per month.
 
He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase jembes and fertilizers for his farming activities.  This will enable him to have a better harvest and meet the family's food consumption needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase jembes and fertilizers for his farming activities.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel, 38, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Hazel has a rope making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Hazel requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Hazel would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients who have increased in the region.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. 

She has been trading in the rural market since 2012. She sells women scarves, kid’s clothing and some hair dyes. She likes her job and has regular customers. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of goods for her small store. 

She awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of goods for her small store.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José es un comerciante de 47 años de edad, realiza diariamente largos desplazamientos para vender su mercancía, trabaja con acolchados como sabanas, cobijas, tendidos, almohadas y también vende cortinas.

El desempleo y la necesidad económica en su hogar llevo a José a emprender este negocio y hoy necesita tu apoyo para seguir impulsándose pues está en etapa de sostenimiento.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía, no cuenta con surtido para vender, tu apoyo sería muy significativo y le brindarías la herramienta a esta persona con la que trabajara para construir un mejor futuro para su hogar, anímate apóyalo.
texts.en: José is a 47 year old businessman who travels long distances each day to sell his merchandise. He works with bedding like sheets, blankets and pillows and he also sells windows. Unemployment and the economic necessities of his household led José to start this business and today he needs your help to continue driving him as he is in a period of stagnation. José wants to request a loan to buy merchandise as he doesn't have the variety to sell. Your help would be very significant and provide the tools needed for this person to work to construct a better future for his household. Go on and support him.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of bedding like sheets, blankets and pillows.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 24 years old and is a single man. He supports two family members.
 
He has been selling tomatoes in the market for the last year and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock of tomatoes to sell in the market and meet client needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and start a motorcycle spare parts shop.
 
His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes to sell in the market and meet client needs.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is 45 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He is a dairy farmer, and he will be using the loan to buy dairy feed, fodder, nappier grass, and hay for his dairy cows and also to build a cow shed. Hr hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to buy more dairy cows, make more income, and support his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and also build a cow shed for his dairy cows. He hopes this will enable him to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between six and 18 years of age. They all go to school. She has farmed for the past seven years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy a cooling tank and milk to sell.

loans.name: Orley

texts.es:
Guiado por los deseos de superación personal, de buscar un mejor futuro para su familia el señor Orley inicio un negocio de confecciones donde hoy en día brinda dos empleos y se proyecta a tener muchos más, al ver que le negocio de la confección a terceros era muy competitiva busco tener su propia línea de ropa y claro igual por unos ingresos extras trabaja para otras personas, pero se enfoco en sacar adelante su propias prendas y un cliente se encarga de distribuirlas, un negocio que tiene desde el año 2011 y que ahora esta viendo sus frutos.

Ahora el señor Orley quiere un poco más lejos, quiere estar siempre a la vanguardia de la moda y no llenar el mercado con los mismo productos, le gusta cambiar su estilo de prendas por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de telas e hilos para sacar su nueva colección que espera tener éxito para que su proyecto crezca y si es todo un éxito podrá tener la posibilidad de contar con un empleado nuevo demostrando que el préstamo será útil para su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Guided by the desire for self-improvement and looking for a better future for his family, Orley started a sewing business.  He now has two employees and plans to have many more.  Upon seeing that the business of making clothes for third parties is very competitive, he is looking to have his own line of clothing.  He works for other people for extra income, but he focuses on getting his own garments ahead, A customer takes charge of distributing them.  He has had the business since 2011, and he is now seeing the fruit of his labor.

Now Orley wants to go a little further.  He always wants to be on the cutting-edge of fashion, and he does not want to fill the market with the same products.  He likes to change the style of his clothes.

Therefore, he wants to request a loan to buy fabric and thread in order to put out his new collection.  He hopes it will be successful so that his project will grow.  If it is a complete success, he will have the chance to get a new employee, demonstrating that the loan will be useful for his growth.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread in order to put out his new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
El socio Mario Enrique se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mario Enrique continues in the business of transporting passengers. By means of this loan, he wishes to advance himself. His dream is to expand his transport business.

Mario Enrique is requesting this loan to purchase tires for his automobile.

He is happy at the prospect of the loan and is committed to complying with his schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car he uses to transport passengers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia se dedica al negocio de venta de frenos para carros,la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar frenos para carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia sells automobile brakes. She is a hard-working and enterprising person who, in this manner, hopes to advance her family.

Julia is requesting this loan to buy more automobile brakes to sell.

Julia is happy at the prospect of the loan and promises to comply with her payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase automobile brakes to sell.

loans.name: Justina Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Justina Andrea  se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Justina Andrea continues to run her restaurant and small grocery store business. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. With this business she hopes to get ahead.

 She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream for her grocery store business to grow. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en: Leopold is 58 years old. He is married with 4 children between the ages of 15 and 26. Three of them go to school. He has farmed for 7 years. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for his family and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is 57 years old. She is married with five children aged between 19 and 30 years old. Three of them go to school. She has farmed for the past eight years. 

With this Kiva loan, she would like to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for family consumption and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank and milk to sell.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Él es Luis es un hombre de 41 años de edad que se encuentra sin empleo, tiene una familia abundante conformada por 7 hijos y su esposa, la necesidad y su familia lo llevan a solicitar un préstamo con el que iniciara un negocio que será la venta de repuesto para motocicleta ya que este es el vehículo mas comprado en Antioquia.

Con el préstamo comprara pastas de frenos, espejos, aceite, luces, tableros entre otros, tu ayuda le brindara al señor Luis una luz de esperanza un negocio para buscar un mejor futuro y calidad de vida para su numerosa y amada familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a 41-year-old man who is currently unemployed. He has an abundant family composed of 7 children and his wife. The needs of his family motivated him to request a loan to initiate a business selling replacement parts for motorcycles, since this is the vehicle most purchased in Antioquia.

With this loan, Luis will purchase brake shoes, mirrors, oil, lights, and panels among other items. Your help will offer Luis a light of hope by means of a new business, allowing him to seek a better future and quality of life for his numerous and beloved family.

loans.use: to launch a business selling replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Jean Mari Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is aged 40 years. He is married with three children aged between six and twelve years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past six years. His wife is a business woman. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to pay his workers who harvest maize for him. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees of his children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay his workers who harvest maize for him.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Ella es Viviana es una mujer de 33 años de edad, amorosa, trabajadora, servicial y gentil, madre de una hija de 9 años de edad (ver foto) que tiene un negocio de venta de calzado, ella se enfoca en el calzado.

Viviana es una mujer casada y junto con su esposo trabajan por darle el mejor futuro a su hija, el negocio le ha traído independencia económica y mejora en las condiciones de vida por ello para ella es muy importante mantenerlo y hacer que este crezca ya que hará de su venta de calzado el negocio más popular y buscado en la región ese es su meta.

Su meta es poder para la educación de sus hijos y está muy empeñada en cumplirla.

Viviana solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de calzado, dando un nuevo aire a su negocio con nuevos estilos buscando atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Vivana is a married woman. She and her husband work to give their daughter a better future. The business has brought her financial independence and improved living conditions. This is why it is very important to her to maintain it and to make her shoe business grow into the most popular and sought after in the region.

Her goal is to be able to provide for the education of her children and she is very committed to achieving it. Viviana seeks a loan to buy a selection of shoes, bringing new life to her business with new styles to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy a selection of shoes to bring her display up to date.

loans.name: Yeison Yordy

texts.es:
El socio Yeison Yordy  se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro que hace tranporte turistico llevando a diferentes turistas a lugares de la ciudad del cusco, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de transporte. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Yeison Yordy makes a living from a transport business. He has a car he uses to transport tourists, bringing them to places in the city of Cusco. He wants to get ahead by means of this business; his dream is to expand his transport business. He is asking for the loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un lobo solitario de 68 años de edad que se dedica a atender su negocio de bar, un negocio que en términos reales es llamado salsamentaría ya que oferta alimentos, bebidas, pero está muy enfocado en la población adulto  mayor.

Tiene su negocio desde el año 2009, fecha en la que decidió buscar su propio camino y dejar de ser empleado para manejar su propio tiempo y tener algo seguro para sostenerse en su vejez.

El sueño de Julio es muy humilde, solo le pide a la vida tener salud pro mucho tiempo para seguir trabajando y rebuscarse su sustento y si hay algo más sería un apoyo de todos ustedes comunidad KIVA, para que Julio pueda comprar surtió de cervezas, aguardiente, ron que son las bebidas de mayor venta en su negocio y comprar añadido frituras en papas que le sirven como pasantes.
texts.en:
Julio is a 68-year-old lone wolf who makes a living with his bar business, which is really considered a pub since it offers food and drinks but is very focused on the older adult population. He has had his business since 2009, when he decided to follow his own path and leave his job in order to manage his own time and have something secure to support him in his old age.

Julio's dream is very humble: he asks life only for his health, for a long time to keep working and supporting himself. If he could ask for anything else it would be support from all of you, the Kiva community, so that Julio will be able to buy an assortment of beer, brandy and rum, which are the drinks he sells the most at his business, and also to buy French fries, which he serves as snacks.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beer, rum and brandy

loans.name: Zesbith Mirellya

texts.es:
La socia Zesbith Mirellya se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Zesbith Mirellya makes a living with her business selling clothing; she sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. She has had this business for a number of years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a variety store. She is asking for the loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia Benita se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Benita makes a living with her grocery store business; she sells staples like rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She has had this business for a number of years and its is going very well. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and crackers

loans.name: Richard Gregorio

texts.es:
RICHARD GREGORIO TIENE 29 AÑOS, CONVIVIENTE CON 01 HIJO. VIVE EN CASA DE FAMILIARES, VIVEN EN CONDICIONES SENCILLAS EN SECTOR ADELINAS DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ. ADELINAS ES UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA MAYORMENTE.

RICHARD GREGORIO TRABAJA COMO OBRERO EN CONSTRUCCION CIVIL, EN OBRAS DIVERSAS, CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE PARTE DE SUS CLIENTES Y VECINOS. EL CREDITO SOLICITADO TENDRA COMO DESTINO LA INVERSIÓN EN COMPRA DE HERRAMIENTAS PARA CONSTRUCCION Y MANTENIMIENTO DEL MOTOR DE MOTOTAXI EN LA QUE SE TRASLADA PARA CUMPLIR SUS LABORES. CON ELLO TENDRÁ UNA MAYOR ATENCIÓN AL CLIENTE E INGRESOS Y POR ENDE UNA MEJORA EN SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Richard Gregorio is 29 years old. He lives with one child in a house owned by family members. He lives in simple conditions in the Adelinas sector of Cayalti district, which belongs to Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. 

Adelinas is a community where most people work in commerce, farming or raising livestock. Richard Gregorio is a construction worker in various civil building projects. He has good references from his clients and neighbors. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his construction work and to ensure maintenance of the motor on the motorcycle taxi he uses to get to and from work. This will result in better service to his clients, better income, and in the end improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for his construction work and to ensure maintenance of the motor on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Valdomero

texts.es:
Valdomero tiene 31 años de edad,soltero, no tiene hijos. Él vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la ganadería y agricultura (cultivo de maiz, papa, camote, vituca y menestras). Valdomero es natural del Caserío Vista Alegre del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, Región Cajmarca, Sierra Norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Valdomero es el comercio – cría y engorde de ganado vacuno; cuenta con experiencia en el rubro. Comercializa su ganado los domingos que es dia de plaza en el distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, tambien cultiva productos de pan llevar (vitucas, yuca, camote, menestras y otros productos), adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, patos y cerdos) para el consumo y en ocaciones para venta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno, para su posterior engorde y venta con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su Madre.
texts.en:
Valdomero is 31 years old, single and has no children. He lives in small community and works mainly in raising cattle and in agriculture (cultivating corn, potato, sweet potato, root crops and vegetables). Valdomero is a native of the Vista Alegre settlement in the Santo Tomas de Cutervo district, in the Cajmarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Valdomero’s business is commerce: he raises and fattens cattle and has experience in the field. He sells his cattle on Sundays, which is the market day in the Santo Tomas de Cuervo district. He also cultivates staple food crops (root crops, yucca, sweet potato, vegetables and other products). Additionally, he raises smaller animals (chickens, guinea pigs, ducks and pigs) for consumption and occasionally for sale.

He is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to later fatten and sell. With this, he will make a greater income and be able to improve his quality of life and that of his mother.

loans.use: to buy cattle to later fatten and sell.

loans.name: Medalid

texts.es:
Medalid tiene 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, patos, cuyes, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales; ella piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará un aumento en su nivel de ventas permitiéndole una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Medalid, age 35, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in the Oyotún district. She lives in a rural area located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, in commerce, and raise animals as their main business activities.
She raises and sells animals like roosters, hens, chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs, etc. She has over 10 years experience in the business, which is located at her house. She is requesting the loan to buy more animals, and this investment will help her to achieve greater variety and productivity with her animals. She plans to increase her stock of animals so that she can satisfy the different tastes and needs of her customers in the area. This will generate an increase in her level of sales, allowing an improvement to her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to fatten up and sell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is aged 33 years. She is married with two children aged between four and seven years. One of her children goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been in business for the past five years. Her husband is also a farmer. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from her business will be used to increase her savings and to pay her children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Jaziel

texts.en:
Jaziel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Jaziel has been in this business for thirteen years. She earns some extra income from food vending.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Dilys

texts.en:
The person shown in the photo is Dilys. She is a single mother aged thirty four years old and has three school-going children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She has gained much from their training and gained experience and skills on how to run and manage her business well. 

Dilys operates a farming business where she plants maize and beans. The business has helped her meet her daily family needs. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy top dressing fertilizers for her farming business. This will help her get high yields and increase her income, which will enable her meet her family's basic needs such as clothing, food, better shelter and education for her children.

Dilys is happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support in achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will improve her crop yield thus providing her with more income to cater for family needs such as clothing, food, shelter and education for her children.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photograph is Caroline, aged forty years and a single parent of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from their training on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. Her economic activity is maize and bean farming. She needs a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. This will enable her to increase her harvest and increase her income. She will therefore be in a position to improve her family’s living conditions including quality health care. 

Caroline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will help increase her harvest and thus cater for family needs such as health care.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system which will help him improve his living conditions.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es emprendedor, optimista, generoso, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’ caracterizado por su gran planicie, donde se plantan vichayas para alimentar al ganado del lugar, ubicado al oeste de la ciudad, a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/16 grados centígrados.
David es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que se dedican al mismo negocio. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la producción de estuco; que es un grano fino formado por cal, mármol, yeso, pigmentos naturales, etc. que se endurece al ser mesclada con agua y Se utiliza para cubrir paredes y techos, “inicié mi actividad como ayudante, ahora todos mis hermanos nos dedicamos al negocio y dividimos el trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes demandan el producto y tiene ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de combustible para trabajar.  Su sueño es comprar una camioneta para transportar piedras, él desea abastecer su negocio mediante la compra de carbón y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de combustible para la explotación de estuco y con los beneficios comprar una camioneta para transportar piedras.
texts.en:
David is a man of 26 years. He is single, without children, and his business is the production of stucco.
He is entrepreneurial, optimistic, generous, patient, responsible and hard-working. He developed his business in the community of "Vichaya", which is characterized by its large plains, where the community plants Vichayas to earn an income. The community is located on the western side of the city, at an elevation of 4000 meters above sea level. The climate is cold and dry the entire year, with temperatures during the day ranging between -1/16 degrees Celsius.

David has a dark complexion, brown eyes and short black hair. He is thin and of medium height. His native language is Aymará, which is spoken in his town. From general knowledge, and because of the business he runs, he also speaks Spanish. He lives with his family, who work in the same business. They live in their own house, built out of adobe, with a roof of corrugated iron. The house has electricity and water, which is extracted from a well with an electric pump.

His business is the production of stucco, a fine powder consisting of lime, marble, gypsum, natural pigments etc., which when mixed with water hardens and is used to cover walls and ceilings. “I started working as an assistant. Now all of my brothers and I work in the business and share the work.” he comments. The advantages of his business are that there is demand for the product and sales are constant. The disadvantage is the lack of fuel to work with. 

David’s dream is to buy a truck to transport stone. He wishes to stock up his business with carbon and fuel to produce stucco. This is the first loan with the organization in his 5 years of running the business independently.

This is why David is requesting a loan to buy fuel for the production of stucco. With the profits he will buy a truck to transport stones.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the production of stucco. With the profits he will buy a truck to transport stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for high production and supply so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine has finished paying back her previous Kiva loan, which helped her boost her income. She is taking a new Kiva loan to continue to expand her business by buying additional stock of books, shoes, bags, sugar, flour and cooking fat.  She hopes that this will help meet her customers' rising demand and help her earn more income. Josephine is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make regular payments back.

loans.use: to buy extra stock of books, shoes, bags, sugar, flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Elina Mercedes

texts.es: Elina de 57 años es habitante en el municipio de San Jacinto en el Departamento de Bolívar, desde la comodidad de su hogar alquila lavadoras a sus vecinos y su idea de negocio surgió gracias a ellos; compró una lavadora para uso doméstico y sus vecinos le propusieron que se las alquilara. Ella observo la oportunidad de ofrecer este servicio al palpar que muchos hogares no poseen este electrodoméstico que hace del lavado una actividad más confortable y aporta al ahorro de agua en comparación al lavado de ropa directamente del grifo.  Muy comprometida con su negocio, todos los días los residentes del sector pueden alquilar las lavadoras por horas o fracción de minutos según su necesidad. Actualmente está aplicando a su primer Credikiva, por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar dos lavadoras más y responder a la demanda.  Su meta a futuro es continuar en el negocio y poder contar con más de 20 lavadoras.
texts.en:
Elina, 57 years old, is a resident of the San Jacinto municipality in the Department of Bolívar. From the comfort of her home, she rents washing machines to her neighbors, and her idea for a business came up thanks to them.

She bought a washing machine for her own use, and her neighbors proposed that she rent it to them. She saw the opportunity to offer this service when she noticed that a lot of houses didn't have this appliance that makes doing laundry a much more comfortable activity and saves water compared to washing clothes directly under the tap.

She is very committed to her business. Every day residents of the area can rent the washing machines for hours or for a fraction of an hour, according to their needs.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy two more washing machines to meet the demand. Her goal is to continue with her business and to be able to have more than 20 washing machines.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines.

loans.name: Joselen

texts.en:
Joselen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joselen is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Joselen has a roasted whole pig business in the Philippines. Joselen has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her business.

Joselen has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Joselen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Darling Dinora

texts.es:
Darling de 29 años de edad,  casada con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de Managua, y se caracteriza por su responsabilidad, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal, esta joven madre lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudio, por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad lucha día día para brindarles a sus pequeños hijos las oportunidades de vida que ella no pudo tener,  en la actualidad lucha para sacar adelante su negocio, mejorarlos, obtener más clientes, y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica un cafetín  y lo tiene ubicado en un hospital de niños de la su comunidad  el cual consiste en vender, desayuno, café con leche, pan, huevos, jugos, refrescos naturales, batidos. Sanguches  motivada por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que le permita la manutención de sus pequeños hijos, y adquirir su independencia económica. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo, y su surtir su cafetín para mantener su clientela, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Darling agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Darling is 29 years old, is married and has two underage children. She comes from Managua, and is characterized by her sense of responsibility, her hard-working attitude and her dreams of self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, this young mother wasn't able to finish her education and now she fights day by day to provide her children with the life opportunities which she couldn't have. She fights to get ahead with her business, improve it, get more customers and satisfy their demands.
Thanks to her drive to get ahead she owns a business which is a small cafe located in one of the local children's hospitals. Her business consists of selling breakfast, coffee, bread, eggs, fruit juices, soft drinks, milkshakes and sandwiches. She is motivated by her need to have an income which allows her to support her small children and acquire her economic independence.
The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her small cafe so that she can maintain her customer base, and perhaps in the not so distant future she will be able to obtain a better income. Darling gives thanks for the help provided by Kiva lenders to people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent line of work.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her small cafe like coffee, bread, eggs, fruit juices, soft drinks, milkshakes and sandwiches

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 44, is married and blessed with three children.  She has managed a direct sales business in her village for almost four years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP per month.  Her net income on this business was usually spent on the school allowances of her children. 

Due to insufficient capital from her business, Marilou would like to obtain a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase face creams, face toners, lingerie, deodorants, and body spray to sell.  She's hoping that her personal purchases business will continue to become more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to purchase face creams, face toners, lingerie, deodorants, and body spray to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 42 years old, married to Esther, and supports a family of 4 children.  He has been operating his retail shop for the last 13 years earning 15,000 KES per month. 

George has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more retail stock to sell and increase his income.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a tax business in the area.  His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope making business in the Philippines.

Liza requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her rope making business.

Liza has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical equipment for his work.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo de 29 años es residente en un barrio ubicado en Cartagena de indias, es un emprendedor hombre que trabajó desde niño en una carnicería y  al observar que el propietario de este negocio obtenía buenas ganancias por comercializar estos productos, consideró que este podría ser su sueño de prosperidad, él poco a poco ahorro de su salario hasta tener lo suficiente para en el año 2011 independizarse.  Su éxito no se hizo esperar, ofrece a domicilio por toda la ciudad distintos cortes de carne de cerdo, lomos finos, perniles, masa de cerdo y demás, es muy comprometido con su trabajo puesto que de lunes a sábado sus clientes pueden realizarle una llamada telefónica y pronto tendrán su pedido en casa.  Para responder al incremento de la demanda está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en diferentes cortes de carne de cerdo.   Reynaldo es padre de una niña de dos años de edad a quien ofrece bienestar y desea ofrecerle una vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  A futuro desea incursionar en otros negocios como una tienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 29, lives in a neighborhood of Cartagena.  He is an enterprising man who has worked since he was a child in a butcher shop.  When he saw that the owner of this business was able to generate good earnings by selling these products, he decided that this could lead to his dream of prosperity.  He gradually saved his wages until he had enough money to establish an independent business in 2011. He had success right away, offering households throughout the city various cuts of pork, fine loins, legs, chunks of pork,and other cuts of meat.  Reynaldo is very devoted to his work. He sells from his post Mondays through Saturdays,and his customers can also make a call and he will promptly deliver their order to their house.  

In order to respond to the growing demand for his products, he is applying for his first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He will invest this loan in a variety of types of pork meat.  Reynaldo is the father of a 2 year-old girl, whom he provides for. He wants to provide her with a home with better living conditions.  In the future, he wants to venture into other businesses, such as a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cuts of pork

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

Leonora has been in this business for 17 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. She is single with two children and has an E-loading business in the Philippines.

Jane requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional load wallet to sell.

Jane has been in this business for one year now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional load wallet to sell.

loans.name: Graciela María

texts.es: Graciela es una mujer de 34 años de edad, que encontró la manera de generar recursos para su familia a través de los servicios de belleza que ofrece a domicilio a los habitantes del municipio de Arjona en el Departamento de Bolívar; ella aprendió a realizar pedicure y manicure gracias a una amiga que fue su instructora quien se dedica también a este arte, sin embargo su interés en profesionalizarse en este oficio no se hizo esperar, mediante una institución del estado pudo acceder y ampliar sus conocimientos, gracias a ello hoy en día ofrece toda una variedad de tratamientos capilares, cortes de cabello, tinturaciones y demás.  Graciela es muy dedicada y comprometida con su trabajo y con su hogar, todos los días de la semana acuerda citas con sus clientes que le permitan cumplir con sus labores y poder atender a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son menores de edad.  Con la finalidad de ampliar sus servicios de belleza, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un secador y una plancha capilar.  Esta inversión permitirá incrementar su base de clientes puesto que era un mercado desatendido por no tener estas herramientas de trabajo.  Su meta familiar a futuro es tener su propia casa y su meta de prosperidad es aperturar un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 34 year-old woman who found the way to generate income for her family through in-home beauty services, which she offers to residents of the municipality of Arjona, in the Bolívar department of Colombia. 

She learned to give pedicures and manicures thanks to a friend who was her instructor, who also does this art. Nevertheless, her interest in becoming a professional in this trade quickly paid off. Through a state institution, she was able to broaden her knowledge, and thanks to this, today she offers a whole variety of hair treatments, haircuts, hair color, and more.

Graciela is very dedicated and committed to her work and her home. Every day of the week, she sets appointments with her clients that permit her to do her work and be able to look after her four children, three of which are under eighteen. 

In order to expand her beauty services, she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a blow dryer and a flat iron. This investment will allow her to increase her client base, since there was a neglected market because she did not have these tools of the trade. 

Her personal goal for the future is to have her own house, and her goal for success is to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a straightening iron.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is 53 years old and married, with one child who still attends school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

For nine years Virginita has operated an egg retail business in the Philippines.  She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of eggs to sell.

In the future, Virginita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 58-year-old married mother. She  is a hardworking woman who sacrifices her life for the sake of her children. 

She started working as a tailor 42 years ago. Because of this experience, her customers trust and support her. That encouraged her in 2002 to establish her existing business. Most of Fatima's customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends.

Fatima is trying hard to develop her business.  Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy tailoring supplies and sell them wholesale. 

She hopes to stay healthy and capable of covering almost all of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies and sell them wholesale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 31 years old and married to Jane, and he supports two family members. He has been a farmer for the last four years, and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing the crops on his farm for a better harvest for family use and to sell in the market.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate himself. His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing the crops on his farm for a better harvest for family use and to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting on her farm so as to produce enough for family use and also for sales to clients in the market.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 64 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Veronica has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eliphus

texts.en:
Eliphus and his family live in a rural home in Rukindu village in Kenya. His wife and two children enjoy dairy farming because it is an important part of their livelihood and a source of food. Eliphus himself is involved in many other activities, including poultry, horticulture, retail shops, and selling cosmetic products. 

Eliphus started dairy farming 12 years ago. This year he is placing more focus on growing his dairy farm. Since he is a seasoned farmer, he knows that feed and health management are key in dairying. 

He is seeking a loan to buy a chaff-cutting machine, which will improve feed processing on his farm. He is expecting improved pasture utilization and milk production as a result of this intervention. 

Your loan will help Eliphus grow his business.  Income from the dairy farm will help him to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Toshmurat

texts.ru: Тошмурат из самой теплой точке Республики Таджикистан. Он в районе Шахритус живет вместе женой и детьми. Тошмурат имеет не большой земельный участок, и он выращивает растение. Он любить заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Тошмурат с утро начинает работать на земле до вечера, потому что доход от растениеводство обеспечить его семью. Он решил открыть себе еще одного источника дохода, заниматься животноводством. Тошмурат собирается взять кредит, и за счет кредита хочет приобрести скота для нового бизнеса. Он уверен в себе и знает, что будет успешным бизнесменом в районе. Тошмурат очень надеется на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите его достичь своих целей.
texts.en:
Toshmurat is from the warmest place in the Republic of Tajikistan. He lives in the Shahrituz region together with his wife and children. Toshmurat has a small plot of land where he grows crops. He loves farming. Toshmurat works the land from morning to night, because the salary from the farming provides for his family. 

Toshmurat decided to take a loan, and would like to use it to purchase livestock for a new business. He believes in himself and knows that he will be a successful businessman in the region. Toshmurat hopes very much for your support. Please help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to start a business

loans.name: Yeraldin

texts.es: Yeraldin, domiciliada en la ciudad de Cartagena de indias, inició su negocio ofreciendo mercancías a sus vecinos y referidos, esta idea de negocio surgió por encontrarse desempleada y como su cónyuge es trabajador independiente sus ingresos no daban abasto para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella necesitaba generar ingresos para ayudarle con el sostenimiento su familia. Esta emprendedora mujer lleva dos años ofreciendo ropa deportiva y casual, con tal éxito que su base de clientes se ha incrementado, razón por la que necesita aplicarle capital a su negocio, para lograr cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, es así como está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará ropa deportiva, camisetas, suéteres, jeans, accesorios para damas y productos capilares. Esta inversión le permitirá tener disponible surtido puesto que como su capital es escaso le toca esperar a que sus clientes le cancelen para volver a reinvertir.  Ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar y desea que a futuro sean unos profesionales.  Su meta de negocio es poder ubicar su local comercial desde su casa y comercializar ropa y artículos misceláneos.
texts.en:
Yeraldin lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  She began her business offering merchandise to her neighbours and people referred to her.  The idea of a business arose because she found herself unemployed and, as her husband is an independent worker, the income was not enough to cover the household expenses.  She needed to generate income to help support her family.

This entrepreneurial woman has spent two years providing sporting and casual clothing with such success that her client base has increased.  For this reason she needs to put capital into her business in order to successfully fill the needs of her customers.  Thus, she is applying for her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo with which she will buy sports clothes, T-shirts, sweaters, jeans, women's accessories and hair products.  This investment would allow her to have an available selection since, as her capital is limited, she has to wait for her clients to pay in order to re-invest.

She is the mother of two young children whose welfare she provides for.  She wishes that in the future they will be professionals.  Her business goal is to be able to locate from her home to business premises and to sell clothing and miscellaneous articles.

loans.use: to buy sports clothes, T-shirts, sweaters, jeans, women's accessories and hair products

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es:
Ruperto tien 31 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como lo es su bicicleta en la cual se despalza a realizar su labor con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, solicita préstamo para mantenimiento y arreglo de su bicicleta y herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; él piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, generar mayores niveles de ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruperto, age 31, is in a common-law relationship and has three children.  He lives with his family in the Oyotún district, which is a rural area in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He provides services as a day worker, and he has his own tools like his bicycle, which he uses to get to his work.  He has over ten years of experience in the business.

He is requesting a loan to fix his bicycle, for maintenance of his bicycle, and for work tools.  This investment will help him to have his equipment and tools in better condition, which will have a big impact on the business.  He is planning to improve the productivity of his services.  This way he will be able to tend to the diverse needs of the customers in the area.  He plans to generate higher levels of income and, in this way, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to fix his bicycle, to provide maintenance on his bicycle, and to get work tools.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is an old woman who is the mother of seven children, only one of whom is in school. She is 51 years old and she lives in a remote area of the Pursat province’s Bakan district. She has earned a living via rice farming and cassava growing for 31 years. Her family’s living income is about 52,100 KHR per day. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

She is leading a group of four members to take the loan from VisionFund and she has just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Ry, who is the leader, will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing farm fee. She hopes to increase her rice crops so as to have sufficient household consumption for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for the plowing farm fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Necia

texts.en:
Necia is 49 years old and married, with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Necia has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Necia has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Battambang province, 42-year-old Phoeurn is the mother of five children. She has struggled to earn a living through cassava growing and rice farming for 12 years. To add more income, she also works for others for a fee.

Phoeurn has joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner this cycle as a fourth-time borrower. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy cassava seeds and also to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so that she will be able to buy more fertilizers for supporting her farming business.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Slamet, one of Ruma’s agents. Slamet lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He and his wife have two cute children. Slamet owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to members of his community. He has already been with Ruma for almost a year. He got to know Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his house. Slamet is a family man, and his community sees him as a trusted and friendly mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Slamet is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. It is important to know that your loan will be very useful to help Slamet improve his business and, accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services.

Slamet's goal regarding Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for low-income communities, one of Ruma's latest products, called Mapan, so that later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Slamet is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old and married to James.  She supports two children. 

She has been a farmer for the past two years, and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and maize seeds for her farm, so as to produce enough for family use and for sale to clients in the market.
