María is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land in order to cultivate it. In the future, María dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land in order to cultivate it.

loans.name: Sausten

texts.en:
Sausten is a hardworking man in Petauke, Zambia who has spent the last six years in the mobile money industry providing financial services to people in his community. He is a 59-year-old widower with seven children. Six of his children are in school and his eldest son Ben helps him run the business. Sausten supports his family through his Zoona mobile money transfer business, as it is his main source of income.

Sausten is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can expand his business by adding another mobile money outlet. He has found a place in Nyimba where he would like to open another mobile money transfer outlet. He is excited to be expanding to the new location as this will help him to increase the number of outlets and earn more profits. The anticipated increase in profits will be used to buy a small piece of land where Sausten intends to start growing maize crops.

Sausten's dream is to keep expanding his business so that his children can have a stable future and in the near future, take over the business. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support and help in educating his children.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded kiosk so that he can open another outlet to continue expanding his business

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a 31-year-old lady who comes from a village named Paschim Jitpur in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal.  Malati is married and a mother of two children who attend school. Malati is engaged in a hand-loom business.

Malati's husband is engaged in a vegetable vending business; he sells varieties of seasonal vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, ladies finger (okra), etc. Malati also deals with the customers in the absence of her husband when he brings stock from the local wholesalers. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable business. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business, but he lacks the capital.  The only way out is to take the help of a business loan. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. 

Therefore, Malati is requesting a business loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for her husband's business. She will purchase fresh vegetables in bulk from the wholesale market. She hopes to get more profit from this business and she wants to save money for her children's education.

Malati is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk from the wholesale market for their business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Olivia tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente, con 1 hijo de 6 años viven en la av san luis, caserio huancas – distrito Querocotillo,que pertenece a Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú. El caserío de Huancas, es un caserío mediano, en el cual la población se dedica a la agricultura , ganadería, comercio.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, patos, ganado porcino, caprino, entre otros.Cuenta con más de sesis años de experiencia en el rubro, con muy buenas referencias, solicita el préstamo para compra de más animales menores y alimentos para el engorde de los mismos, esto le permitirá tener mayores volúmenes de ventas y por lo mismo generará una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olivia is 31 years old. She has a live-in partner and one six-year-old son. She lives on Avenue San Luis in the village of Huancas, Querocotillo district, part of the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. Huancas is a medium-sized village where most of the people are in agriculture, commerce, and cattle ranching.

She is in the business of raising and selling pen animals like guinea pigs, hens, ducks, swine, goats, and more. She has six years of experience in the field and very good references. She is requesting this loan to buy more young animals and the feed to fatten them. This will help increase her sales volume and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy more young animals and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a battery to reactivate his solar energy system, which will benefit his family.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married to Richard.  She supports her children. She has been selling maize cereals for the last 19 years and the business earns her KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stock of maize cereals to sell to clients and meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize cereals to sell to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds for planting in the green house for more income gain.

loans.name: Bakhargiul

texts.en:
Bakhargiul is a 51-year-old woman, from Karataklia village. She has her son, daughter-in-law and pensioner mother-in-law in the family. Her salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. With the help of her family members, Bakhargiul is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of her family's income. For more than 20 years, she has been involved in the cultivation of greens. Bakhargul sells the agricultural products in the open market, located in the capital. As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, she wants to increase her family's income in order to more effectively meet their daily costs.

A loan of 4,500 GEL will be a great support to Bakhargiul and her family, enabling her to purchase a car. Her son will start a taxi business with the purchased car and generate significant income.

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Bakhargul and her son will be able to create better living conditions for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son, who will start a taxi business.

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores, de 42 años de edad, está casada, se dedica a la panadería, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido al nivel de pobreza que tenía su familia; su esposo es agricultor y a veces trabaja como albañil.

Dolores, desde su niñez aprendió acerca de la agricultura, por eso aprendió a trabajar fuertemente; también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas indias para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su esposo. 

Dolores, necesita el dinero para comprar abono, pesticidas y para pagar maquinaria para preparar la tierra, ya que se acerca el tiempo para sembrar y fertilizar sus cultivos.

Dolores, en el futuro sueña con que sus tres hijos lleguen a graduarse y ser profesionales, para que tengan una vida con más oportunidades que las que ella ha llegado a tener.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 42, is married. Her primary business is running a bakery. She went to school through the fourth grade due to her family's poverty. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes works as a bricklayer.

Since her childhood, Dolores has learned about farming, so she knows how to work hard. She also raises pigs and spotted chickens to increase her income and help her husband.

Dolores needs money to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for machinery to prepare her land, as it nearly time to plant and fertilize her crops.

In the future, Dolores dreams of seeing her children graduate and become professionals so that they have more opportunities in life than she had.

loans.use: buy manure and pesticides and pay for machinery to prepare her land

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Mercy. She used her first Kiva loan to increase the funds that she uses to serve her customers. This helped her to facilitate more transactions and provide better service to her customers. Mercy wants to let her Kiva lenders know that the loan has empowered her and she is able to contribute to her household and send money back home to her parents.

Mercy is now applying for a second Kiva loan, which she plans to use to finance her business by buying a new branded kiosk which she can use to serve customers at her new location. The loan will also help her to provide working capital float. This is the money that she will use to serve customers on a daily basis at her new location. These funds will ensure that Mercy has enough money to fulfill her customers’ transactions. This then helps to increase her commissions, which she depends on for her income. This also makes sure she never has to turn away customers who need to transact.

Mercy is positive that once she receives her loan, her revenue will double and she will be able to improve her education through distance learning. She would like to go back to school and get a Bachelor's degree so that she can be a good example for her family. Mercy thanks the Kiva lenders for their support with the growth of her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To buy a new kiosk and open a new Zoona mobile money transfer outlet in Lusaka, Zambia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Brenner

texts.en:
Brenner is 29 years old. He is married and has a seven-month-old baby. He manages three mobile money transfer businesses in Zambia where he helps customers send money around the country without needing a bank account. He loves his job because of the opportunity to interact with many different people every day and to provide a much-needed service to his community. He has been running his Zoona mobile money transfer business for two years. 

This is Brenner's first loan from Kiva. He is very grateful for the opportunity to have access to loans so that he can grow his business. He says this loan will have a huge impact on his business as it will enable him to expand without stretching his limited resources.

The business helps him to sustain his family’s needs. Brenner currently employs three people. He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a big trading kiosk and increase the working capital float in his shops. This will be a short-term loan to help him build his capital across his shops. He will use the money to serve customers on a daily basis. This will help him to earn more profits, as he will be able to serve customers better and continue growing his business. 

Brenner's goal is to open up more outlets and continue to empower the youth in his community by creating jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a big trading kiosk and  increase the working capital float in his shops

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 36 years old, an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for three years. Her husband is the only responsible person to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Rehana's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories, e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business purposes. 

Therefore Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to purchase the above tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Rehana is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to give her husband financial assistance to expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to give her husband financial assistance to repair his taxi

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the past eight years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Mussarat has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Mussarat's husband can afford the maintenance easily. He will then be able to provide better transport facilities and earn a profitable income. Mussarat also plans to make savings with the profits from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Mussarat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Dossou est un homme de 39 ans. Père de 3 enfants âgés tous scolarisés, il gagne sa vie en exerçant comme commerce la revente d’appareil de sonorisation. Servant une catégorie très variée de clientèle, il rêve d’avoir une boutique et de pouvoir employer des jeunes aspirants à son domaine d’activité. Il effectue ses opérations financières depuis cette année avec WAGES et sollicite un crédit en vue de s’approvisionner en appareils de sonorisation variés. Il espère prendre son envol avec ce crédit et participer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Il est dans cette activité il y a 08ans.
texts.en:
Dossou is a man of 39, father of three children, all enrolled in school. He earns his living as a merchant by reselling sound systems. He has been in this business for eight years.  Serving a very varied clientele, he dreams of having a shop and being able to employ young apprentices to his branch of commerce. 

Since this year, he has been making his financial transactions with WAGES and is asking for a loan in order to stock up on various sound systems. He hopes to see his business take off with this loan and to participate actively in his children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy sound systems for resale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another cow and animal feed. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy another cow and animal feed

loans.name: Lorena Roxana

texts.es:
Lorena, de 41 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 17 años de edad.

Lorena, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura en las parcelas que posee, este oficio lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su esposo y en la tarde se dedica a trabajar en un programa para el desarrollo de su comunidad.

Lorena, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, porque cuando no está trabajando en el programa de la comunidad, se dedica a vender leche en los alrededores de su vivienda y la vaca le ayudara a incrementar la producción.

Lorena, desea darles una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que lleguen a ser personas de bien para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lorena, 41, finished high school. She is married with two children ages 10 and 17. Her husband is a farmer.
Lorena works in agriculture on the land she owns. She works in the morning with her husband and in the afternoon she works in a community development program.
Lorena needs a loan to buy a cow. When she is not working on the community program she sells milk around her neigborhood and a cow will help her increase production.
Lorena would like to provide her children with a better education so they can be productive members in their community.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi un homme de 44ans a pour femme une revendeuse et père de 03 enfants de 10, 08 et 06ans. Il revend des produits de détails(sandalette, savons de toilette et pâte dentifrice dans sa boutique. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un troisiéme crédit à WAGES. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira d'ouvrir d'autres boutiques et assurer le bien - etre de la famille.
texts.en: Komi, a man of 44, is married to a small-scale retailer and is the father of three children aged 10, 8, and 6 years old. He retails various products (sandals, bath soap, and toothpaste) in his shop. In order to expand his business, he is requesting a third loan from WAGES. The profit from his sales will allow him to open other shops and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy sandals for resale

loans.name: Norma Roxana

texts.es:
NORMA ROXANA TIENE 33 AÑOS, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA JUNTO SUS HIJOS Y CONYUGUE EN EL SECTOR CORRAL DE PALOS EN EL DISTRITO CAYALTI, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, UBICADA EN LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO QUE PERTENECE A LA REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERÚ.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES COMO GALLINAS, PATOS, PAVOS, ADEMÁS. EL CRÉDITO SOLICITADO TENDRÁ COMO DESTINO LA INVERSIÓN EN COMPRA DE ANIMALES Y MANTENIMIENTO DE CULTIVO AGRICOLA. ASÍ, TENDRÁ MAYORES INGRESOS Y CALIDAD PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES, POR CONSIGUIENTE GENERAR INGRESOS PARA UNA MEJORA EN CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Norma Roxana is 33 years old. She lives with her partner in a house they own with their children in the Corral de Palos area, Cayalti District. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region, north coast of Peru.
She works in agriculture and selling small animals such as chicken, ducks, turkeys and others. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of more animals and for the upkeep of her crops. This way, she will increase her income and will be able to offer better quality items to her customers, which will generate more income to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock and farming upkeep supplies.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
CLOTILDE TIENE 54 AÑOS DE EDAD, SEPARADA, VIVE CON SUS HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE ZAÑA, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DEL PERU.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE CRIANZA DE GANADO VACUNO, DESDE HACE MAS DE 15 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO. TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES MENORES GALLINAS, PATOS Y CUYES, CONTANDO CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE ALIMENTO PARA EL ENGORDE DE SUS ANIMALES, DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO,OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Clotilde, age 54, is separated and lives with her children in their own home. They live in a large community in the urban area of Zaña, part of Chiclayo, Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Clotilde is in the business of raising cows. She has 15 years of experience in this line of work, which she runs out of her home. She also raises and sells small animals like hens, ducks, and guinea pigs. She has excellent references.She is requesting this loan so that she can buy feed to fatten her animals, thus growing her business, earning more money, and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: buy balanced feed to fatten her animals

loans.name: El Rostro De Mi Pueblo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El rostro de mi pueblo está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Leticia una joven laboriosa de 21 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas, su esposo le ayuda a realizar las figuras para ofrecer una diversidad de estilos a sus clientes, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de papel china, papel crepe alambre y almidón, una de sus metas es hacer crecer el negocio, la segunda socia es Sayda de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de gas butano en su domicilio y la tercer socia es Eimi de 23 años quien se dedica a la venta comida.
texts.en:
The united group "El Rostro de mi Pueblo" (The Face of my Village) is comprised of three enterprising women and run by Leticia, a hard-working 21-year-old wife and mother. She runs a business making and selling piñatas. Her husband helps her to build the shapes to offer her customers greater variety. She will use this loan to buy tissue paper, crepe paper, wire, and starch. One of her goals is to grow her business.

The second member is Sayda, age 25, who is is in the business of selling butane gas out of her home. Eimi, age 23, is the third member and she sells food.

loans.use: buy tissue paper, crepe paper, wire, and starch

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 65 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja también es agricultor y no tienen hijos.

Teresa, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura en las parcelas que alquila, este trabajo lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a elaborar comida típica y a venderla en los alrededores de la comunidad, mientras su esposo cuida los animales.

Teresa, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono y pesticidas, estos insumos los necesita para sembrar y llegar a obtener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.

Teresa, desea incrementar la venta de la leche y comprar más animales.
texts.en:
Teresa is 65 years old. She didn't go to school. She lives with her partner. They are both farmers and they have no children.
Teresa works in agriculture in parcels that she rents. She does this job with her husband in the morning and she makes local food for sell the rest of the day. She sells food around town in her community while her husband takes care of their animals.
Teresa needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to sew healthy cops to support her family. Teresa wishes to increase her milk production and to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rpto. Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario, llamado “Rpto. Unión”, está integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día para salir adelante.  Ellas por 4ta. vez solicitan crédito a ADIM. 
La coordinadora del grupo es María, de 37 años, ella y su acompañante de vida trabajan para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su bebe de 8 meses de nacido. Ella tiene un taller de costura en su domicilio.  Con crédito otorgado comprara conos de hilos, tela sintética y tela drill. Para así seguir creando más diseños y ofrecerlos a su variada clientela.
Las otras integrantes son Janneth, 30 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace más de 1 año. Rosalina, 50 años, produce y vende hisopos. Sara, 60 años,  se dedica a la preparación de comida, refrescos y además vende gaseosas.
texts.en:
The group named "Rpto. Unión" is made up of 4 women entrepreneurs who work every day to get ahead.  They are requesting their fourth through ADIM.  

The group coordinator is María, who is 37 years old.  Her and her partner are working to provide a better quality of life for their 8-month-old baby.  She has a tailoring workshop in her home.  With the loan she will buy spools of thread, synthetic fabric, and denim.  This will help her to continue creating designs to bring to her various customers.

The other members are: Janneth, 30 years old, who has worked selling new clothing for more than a year; Rosalina, 50 years old, who makes and sells brushes; and Sara, 60 years old, works selling food and drinks.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, synthetic fabric and denim.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: keep up with demand by repairing one of his mills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on the farm as well as lease more land for farming so as to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad.

Carolina, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura durante la mañana junto a su esposo en la parcela que alquila y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar una vaca que tiene y la leche la utiliza para el consumo familiar.

Carolina, necesita el crédito para comprar una novilla, para que en el futuro le dé más leche y empezar a producir lácteos para vender en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Carolina, sueña con construir una vivienda digna, para su familia ya que actualmente su casa es de lámina.
texts.en:
Carolina is 25. She finished high school. She has a partner and a one-year-old son.
Carolina works in agriculture in the morning with her husband on a parcel they rent and she milks a cow she owns in the afternoon which she uses for family consumption.
Carolina needs a loan to buy a heifer, to have more milk in the future to begin making dairy products to sell around town.
Carolina dreams to have a nice home for her family as her current house is laminated.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Patron Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SALVADOR DEL MUNDO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Salvador, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia siembra maíz, la socia cría las gallinas y cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de queso, la socia vende los quesos a diferentes personas, por medio de estos pequeño negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas y cuyes.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chanchos, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These partners belong to the community bank “PATRON SALVADOR DEL MUNDO”. This bank is located in the district of San Salvador, province of Calca and department of Cusco.
Mery is one of their members. She is 43 years old with two children. She works selling and raising animals. She also works in agriculture. She cultivates corn, raises hens and guinea pigs. She fattens these animals to later sell in different fairs. She also sells cheese to different customers. With all these small businesses she is able to support her children. Her dream is to own a store where she could sell hens and guinea pigs. She is asking for this loan to buy more animals.
The rest of the members work in ranches, they sell chicha, groceries, and agriculture related items.
Mery is thankful to those who are part of her dream through these means and she is committed to replay this loan on time.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma continúa con su negocio de venta de lechones y tamales para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le  pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tamales entre otros.
La socia solicito el crédito para  la compra de manteca, entre otros.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the community bank VELASCO ASTETE. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, province and department of the same name.
Norma continues to work selling piglets and tamales to different customers who seek her services. She's been in the field for quite a while thanks to her daily hard work. She wants to keep working to continue supporting her family.
She is asking for this loan to buy tamales and butter among other items.

loans.use: to buy tamales and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for topdressing her farm's crops, which will improve the soil and yield a better harvest.

loans.name: Santos Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada, su esposo es agricultor  y tienen tres hijos, de los cuales solo estudian dos.

Carolina, es una persona luchadora, es por eso que desde muy pequeña, como no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, en criar ganado y cerdos.- Actualmente, siembra maíz y frijol, cría ganado y cerdos, todo lo realiza con ayuda de su esposo, de esta forma obtienen ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz.

Carolina, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 32, never had the chance to go to school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have three children, two of whom are in school

Carolina is a fighter. Ever since she was little, since she couldn't go to school, her parents taught her how to farm and how to raise hogs and cattle. Today, she plants corn and beans, raises hogs and cattle, and she does it all with the help of her husband. Together, they are able to cover the household expenses. This loan will be invested in purchasing farming supplies to plant corn.

Carolina's goal is to improve her home and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy farming supplies to plant corn

loans.name: Susana Claribel

texts.es:
Susana, elabora tortillas y pupusas para vender a sus vecinos, actualmente es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres y con tres hermanos, no recibe ayuda económica de nadie, su negocio lo abrió con la finalidad de ser independiente y ayudar a su familia, su negocio lo realiza en dos jornadas durante el día, de 8:30 a.m. a 12:30 meridiano realiza la venta de tortillas y las pupusas las vende de 5:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m., en el negocio colabora toda la familia. 
Actualmente compra maíz cada tres días lo cual le genera más costos, ha tomado a bien solicitar un crédito para comprar maíz al mayoreo y así adquirirlo a un precio más bajo, tendrá la oportunidad de tener un margen mayor de ganancias y serán el respaldo para el pago de la deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son tener mejores circunstancias económicas, cancelar su crédito y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana makes tortillas and pupusas to sell to her neighbors.  She is single, does not have any children and lives with her parents and her three siblings.  She does not receive financial assistance from anyone, and she opened her business with the goal of becoming independent and helping her family out.

She works in her business two days a week: she makes the tortillas and pupusas from 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and sells them from 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.  The whole family helps her with the business.  She currently buys corn every three days which causes her costs to go up.  She thought of requesting a loan in order to buy the corn by wholesale to get it for a lower price.  This will give her the opportunity to have a greater income which will support her in paying back the loan. 

Her hopes are to have better finances, to repay the loan, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn for her business.

loans.name: Vaniza

texts.en:
Vaniza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vaniza is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Vaniza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vaniza requested a 18,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Vaniza has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 1, 5, 7, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de medias, guantes y calzoncillos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por recibir a la población migrante del campo a la ciudad, que agrupa una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Silvia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior masculina como; guantes, calzoncillos, medias, mallas y otros, “vendo de forma ambulante transportando toda mi mercadería y a mi pequeño bebé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es independiente y puede cuidar a su hijo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir su negocio y ofertar mayora variedad. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa interior masculina para surtir su negocio y aumentar su oferta para pagar los  gastos de vacunas de su bebé.  Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior masculina y con los beneficios pagar los gastos médicos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 31, lives with her partner. They have five children, ages 1, 5, 7, 10 and 12 years. She's a good mother, independent, consistent, optimistic, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs a business selling socks, gloves, and underpants from a mobile cart. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, an area that receives most of the migrants coming from the country to the city. Commerce in the area is predominantly small-time retail and informal. The climate is warm and subtropical with daytime temperatures varying from 21-35C degrees (70-95F).

Silvia has brown skin and brown eyes and long dark hair that she wears tied back at her neck. She is short and of medium build. Her speaks her native language of Guaraní at home and with family and speaks Spanish in public and to run her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children, who are all in school except for the youngest. They live in a brick and cement home with a laminated metal roof and a tile floor and have running water, electricity, and sewer services.

For her business, she sells undergarments including gloves, boxers, socks, leggings, and more.  "I travel with my business, carrying all my merchandise as well as my little one," she says. One advantage of her business is that she's independent and can care for her baby son. The disadvantage is that she doesn't have the capital she needs to stock her business and offer more variety. Her goal is to open a store selling clothing.

She will use this loan to buy men's underwear to stock her business, and with the profit from these sales, she will pay for her baby's vaccinations. This is her first loan sequence with the institution and she has three years of experience with the business.

loans.use: pay her baby's medical expenses by buying and selling men's undergarments

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lorlyn has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Lorlyn has been in this business for 3 years now. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another to further build her business.

In the future, Lorlyn would like to build and expand her business so she can provide her family with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her business by buying an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Sujey

texts.es:
La clienta es una mujer trabajadora, jefa de hogar, madre de 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudiantes y una niña pequeña; Sugey busca incrementar sus ingresos y poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Ella junto a su familia cuentan con un negocio de servicio de organización de eventos y catering service llamado La Cuchara de Mamá, negocio que le permite aumentar sus ingresos y darle la oportunidad a otras personas de tener trabajo. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita, mantiene una buena moral de pago.
 La clienta comenzó su proyecto de servicio de eventos, hace  6 años con el primer crédito que le otorgó la Fundación Mujer.  Actualmente requiere de apoyo económico nuevamente para poder pagar la prima de un automóvil que les permita el traslado de todo el equipo, así como las comidas. 
Sus clientes son cualquier tipo de personas que desean hacer algún tipo de evento o celebración, su cartera de clientes ha crecido y gracias a la calidad de sus servicios se han dado a conocer. Cubren eventos en cualquier parte de país. El crédito es de suma importancia ya que le va a permitir contar con una herramienta vital, que es la adquisición de un automóvil adecuado para el transporte de todo el equipo necesario para la realización de los eventos.
texts.en:
The client is a hard-working woman, the parent of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school, and a young daughter. Sugey is seeking to increase her income, which will enable her to give her children a better quality of life. 

She and her family have a business organizing events and providing catering services, called "La Cuchara de Mamá" (Mama's Spoon).  The business allows her to increase her income and give other people the chance to have work. This is the third loan she has applied for, and she has maintained a good repayment record.

The client started her event services business 6 years ago with the first loan she was granted by Fundación Mujer. Currently she needs financial help again, in order to make a downpayment on a car which will allow them to transport all their equipment, as well as the food.

Their customers are any kind of people who wish to hold an event or celebration. Her list of customers has grown, and thanks to the quality of her services she has become well known. They organize events in any part of the country. 

The loan is extremely important, as it will allow them to have a vital work tool, an adequate vehicle for transporting all the necessary equipmnt for doing the events.

loans.use: to make a downpayment on a car which will allow them to transport all their equipment, as well as food.

location.town: Montes de Oca, San Pedro, Vargas Araya

loans.name: Catherine Joy

texts.en:
Catherine Joy is 26 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Catherine Joy has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Conchita

texts.en:
Ma. Conchita is 41 years old and has two children who are in school. Ma. Conchita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc.

Ma. Conchita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ma. Conchita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 40,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell like soap, milk, noodles, etc.

Flordeliza has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell like soap, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Liliam

texts.es:
Rosa, vive únicamente con un hijo de 21 años de edad, solo él depende económicamente de ella; su fuente generadora de ingresos es una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y también desarrolla actividades agrícolas, tiene su negocio en el mercado desde hace 8 años, aprendió a realizarlo con la ayuda de sus padres, hoy en día lo desempeña con mucho entusiasmo por qué sabe que si su negocio se mantiene podrá tener un estilo de vida digno, ella no tiene ayuda económica de familiares.
Ha decidido solicitar un crédito que será de ayuda para comprar maíz, arroz, azúcar, bebidas, boquitas, etc., con ello busca tener un negocio mucho más surtido, espera que las ventas se mantenga para que sus ingresos sean mayores y pueda mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
Para Rosa es muy importante administrar correctamente el préstamo y lograr resarcirlo sin problemas de pago.
texts.en:
Rosa lives alone with her 21-year-old son. He is her only dependant. Her source of income is a small booth where she sells basic items and she also works in agriculture. She's had a booth at the market for 8 years. She learned this trade from her parents and today she is happy to go to work every day. This work allows her to have a decent life as she has no financial help from her relatives.
She decided to ask for a loan to buy corn, rice, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, to have a larger variety to offer in her business. She is hoping for steady sales increase her income and to improve her quality of life.
Rosa feels it is very important to manage this loan and to repay it without any issues.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, soft drinks, snacks, to have a larger variety of offer in her business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad, que se caracteriza por su intensa actividad económica y el asentamiento de los mercados más grandes de innumerables galerías y locales comerciales. De clima templado y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Laura es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello gris largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó a solicitar un préstamo para prosperar en su negocio. Su negocio es la preparación y venta de pollo a la broaster (pollo frito), que es un modo de cocinar el pollo muy sabroso y casero, para freírlo se utiliza bastante aceite, “la preparación no es complicada, se fríe el pollo en aceite caliente hasta dorarlo y quede bien crocante, y se acompaña con papas fritas, arroz y ensalada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos la desventaja es la competencia porque se encuentra en una zona comercial. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de venta de pollo frito. Ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como; aceite, pollo, arroz, y otros, para trabajar en su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para trabajar en su negocio y pagar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is 49 years old, single, and has a 9-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling fried chicken, and is located in the south of the city.  The area is characterized by its lively business activity and the presence of large markets with innumerable stores and local businesses.  The climate is mild and dry with a temperature that ranges between 18 and 25 degrees centigrade during the day. Laura has tan skin, dark eyes, long gray hair she keeps tied back, and is of medium build.  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish for general use and for her business.

She shares her life with her daughter who is studying in school.  They live in their own house built from brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. They have electricity and well water they get from a pump.  

Her wish to improve her business led her to request a loan to make it succeed.  Her business is in making and selling fried chicken, a method of cooking that is tasty and homemade.  In order to fry the chicken she uses a lot of oil and comments that "the preparation is not complicated, the chicken is fried in hot oil until is golden and crispy, and is served with french fries, rice, and salad".

The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers, the disadvantage is the competition since she lives in a commercial area.  Her dream is to open a restaurant making fried chicken.  She wants to use the loan to buy cooking supplies for her business such as oil, chicken, and rice.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years she has been doing this work.  

She is requesting the loan to buy cooking supplies for her business and cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies for her business selling fried chicken.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 50 años de edad, conviviente , reside en casa propia, natural de Morropón, Región Piura, Costa Norte de Perú. La vida en mencionado distrito es tranquila ,sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería,como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí, entre otros.

La actividad que realiza nuestra ella, es la venta de abarrotes dicha actividad la realiza hace más de 10 años,con experiencia en el negocio,con muy buenas referencias en la zona. Destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo, compra de mercadería para su negocio (arroz, azúcar, abarrotes) y mejoras de vivienda. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido al crecimiento económico de la zona, esto generará mayores ingresos y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 50 years old, lives with a partner in their own home, and is a native of Morropón, Piura Region, North Coast of Peru. Life in that district is peaceful and the inhabitants work at agriculture and keeping livestock as their primary means of support. They plant and harvest bananas, corn, and black-eyed peas among other crops.

Marcelina makes her living selling groceries, and has done so for more than ten years. She has experience in the business and very good references in the district. The loan will be used as work capital, for the purchase of merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, groceries) and for home improvements. The market has good prospects because of economic growth in the area, which will generate greater income for her and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, groceries) and to improve her home.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 40 years old, and she is married with 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for all of them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries. She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Celina Yaneth

texts.es:
Celina, de 29 años de edad, no tuvo posibilidad de estudiar, está casada, su esposo es albañil y tienen dos hijos.

Celina, inicio a trabajar desde la edad de 10 años, junto a sus abuelos en la siembra de maíz y frijol; también trabajo casi siete años como empleada domestica y casi tres años en una tortillería; todo esto lo ha hecho con la idea de salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

El crédito sera utilizado para iniciar el negocio de venta de tortillas, ya que posee la experiencia en este negocio y lo más importante es que podrá ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. 

El sueño de Celina, es mejorar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celina is 29. She didn't have the chance to go to school. She is married with two children and her husband works in construction.
Celina started working when she was 10 years old with her grandparents cultivating corn and beans; she also worked cleaning houses for 7 years and almost 3 years making tortillas. She's been able to get ahead thanks to her work experience and she's been helping her husband improve the quality of life of their family.
She will use this loan to start a tortilla making business, as she has experience in the field. The most important factor is that she'll be able to help her family succeed. 
Celina's dream is to make improvements to her home and to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to start a business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Esmelda Del Socorro

texts.es: Esmelda es una microempresaria emprendedora de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, por los que trabaja día a día para darles un futuro mejor, ella es  propietaria de un salón de belleza desde hace dos años donde ofrece a sus clientes el servicio de corte de cabello, tintes, manicure y pedicure, para lograr dar un servicio rápido y eficaz contrato a una colaboradora quien le ayuda a atender a los clientes, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tintes, cremas, champo, acondicionador y cosméticos.
texts.en: Esmelda is a 34-year-old business woman. She is married with three children, and she works for them every day to provide them with a better future. She's owned a beauty salon for 2 years and she offers services such as hair cuts, hair dyes, manicute and pedicute. To provide a faster and more efficient service, she hired an assistant to help her. She wants to use this loan to buy hair dye, lotions, shampoo, conditioner and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, lotions, shampoo, conditioner, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Rebecca has been able to turn the tide in her favor these days and is making good sales. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. 

Recently, Rebecca took a loan to both buy more grocery items and expand her business. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to both buy more grocery items and expand her business

loans.name: Yessenia Patricia

texts.es:
Yessenia de 35 años de edad, casada con cuatro hijos en edades comprendida de  17/15/15/10 años, originaria de Managua, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en la actualidad lucha para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y brindarles la estabilidad económica, física, emocional, que ellos se merecen. Y cumplir su mayor sueño como es ver formados a sus hijos en profesionales,
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de sopa en su casa de habitación, negocio que surgió cuando la liquidaron de la empresa donde trabaja y las necesidades y las circunstancias, surgió la idea, para generar y aportar dinero a la familia. El negocio lo desempeña desde hace cinco años y lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, la rutina de trabajo de esta mujer de unas diez horas diarias preparando la sopa y posteriormente la venta dese las 4: am hasta las 2: pm. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles para la preparación de las sopas, como: yuca, plátanos, pollo, gallinas, mondongo, tomates, naranja agrias, leña, bolsas, servilletas, quequisques, maduros, guineos verdes, repollos, jocotes, etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Yessenia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 35 years old, married with 4 children of ages 17, 15, 15, and 10 years old. Originally from Managua, she is characterized as hard working, responsible, and with desire for self improvement. Now she is struggling to raise her children and provide economic, physical, and emotional stability they deserve, and fulfill her biggest dream to see her children as professionals. Thanks to her desire to succeed she engages in the economic activity of selling soups in her house. This business arose when the company where she worked liquidated and due to the circumstances and the necessity, she came up with the idea to make money and contribute to the family.

The business has served for 5 years and is located in her house. The routine of work of this woman is 10 hours a day making soup and then selling it, from 4:00 a.m. until 2:00 pm. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and her business in purchasing products for the preparation of soups, such as cassava, bananas, chicken, tripe, tomatoes, sour orange, wood, bags, napkins, green bananas, cabbage, plums, etc. Therefore, in the not too distant future she can achieve better incomes. 

Yessenia thanks the Kiva investors for the assitance they give to poor people and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for soups such as meat, chicken, cassava, tomatoes, bananas, onions, sweet peppers, corn, etc.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. She is 56 years old and married, and she busies herself to sufficiently provide for her family. 

Salina grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Through its support of her gardening activities, she credits the cooperative with helping build her capital. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Salina wishes to become the supplier of crops in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Eric Fernando

texts.es:
Eric es un joven estudiante que vive en el Distrito de Orcopampa, ubicado en Arequipa cuya ciudad se encuentra en la parte Sierra Sur del Perú. 

Él se encuentra estudiando 1 año y aún le falta 2 años para poder culminar. La carrera elegida por él es Mecánica de Producción porque le gusta mucho trabajar con máquinas y herramientas de soldadura, tornos, frisas y fabricar piezas. Su carrera le dará la facilidad de tener un trabajo y así apoyar a su comunidad, pero sobretodo a su familia porque les permitirá tener estabilidad económica.

Durante el tiempo de sus estudios, le va regular, porque está muy preocupado debido a que no cuenta con los medios económicos para poder continuar con su carrera, afectándolo a veces en su salud personal. Siendo esto su mayor obstáculo. Le dedica 8 horas diarias a sus estudios, a parte de las clases prácticas que pueda tener. 

Eric recurre a KIVA para que le brinden el apoyo que necesita y así pueda continuar estudiando, por eso que este préstamo lo utiliza exclusivamente para cubrir los gastos de su carrera en SENATI, así podrá realizarse como persona, llegando a ser un profesional técnico. Al haber obtenido este Crédito, Eric se siente realmente más tranquilo, ya que la mayor preocupación que afectaba a su familia era la del pago de pensiones, que ahora ya estaría cubierto gracias a KIVA.

Cuando termine sus estudios, Eric piensa irse a trabajar a una importante empresa, especializarse más en su carrera y poder recibir mayores ingresos. Su mayor sueño es ser un gran profesional Mecánico, poder colaborar con el desarrollo de su comunidad por medio de su carrera.

Por ahora, Eric se siente muy bien, más animado a continuar y más tranquilo ya que podrá concluir con sus estudios. Eric les deja su mensaje: "Quiero agradecerles muchísimo señores de KIVA, porque gracias a su gran apoyo podré terminar mi carrera, la cual me gusta mucho".
texts.en:
Eric is a young student who lives in the district of Orcopampa, located in Arequipa a city located in the Southern Andes of Peru. He is studying in his first year and needs two more years to complete his studies. He chose Mechanical Production as his studies as he likes to work with machines, soldering equipment, lathes, and making parts.

His studies will give him the ability to get a job and support his community but moreover would provide his family with financial stability. His studies have been going so-so for him as he is very preoccupied since he does not have the economic means to continue with his course and at times this has affected his personal health. This has been his major obstacle. He spends eight hours per day at his studies not counting the practical classes he might have.

Eric has turned to Kiva for the support he needs to be able to continue to study. He will use this loan exclusively to cover the costs of his studies at SENATI and be able to fulfill himself as a person becoming a professional technician. Having been granted this loan Eric feels much more calm as the major worry that affected his family was paying his tuition, which is now covered thanks to Kiva. When he finishes his studies Eric is thinking that he might go work for a big company, specialize more in his studies and be able to earn more income.

His big dream is to become a great Mechanic, be able to help with the development of his community through his work. For now Eric feels good, more inspired to continue and more calm as he can now finish his studies. Eric sends this message "I want to thank the people at Kiva as thanks to their firm support I can finish my studies, which makes me very happy".

loans.use: to pay off his debt for his Mechanical production course and become an excellent technical professional.

loans.name: Yesenia Arely

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 20 de edad, es una joven muy luchadora, está estudiando bachillerato, su madre falleció cuando tenía 12 años de edad y desde entonces ha vivido con su tía, quien le ha apoyado como si fuese su madre.

Yesenia, es una joven muy emprendedora, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas junto a su tía, esto le ayuda mucho económicamente a Yesenia, porque con estos ingresos puede pagar sus estudios; ellas venden tres veces a la semana porque esos días ella sale un poco más temprano de clases y el horario de venta es de 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 de la noche.

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar una plancha industrial para hacer pupusas, ya que la que posee actualmente es de una vecina y se la ha prestado, es por eso que necesita tener una propia porque  es la herramienta principal para su negocio.

El sueño de Yesenia, es graduarse de una carrera universitaria y mantener siempre su negocio y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yesenia, who is 20 years old and studying a pre-university course, is very tenacious.Her mother died when she was 12 years old and since then she has lived with her aunt, who has raised Yesenia as if she were her own. 

Yesenia, an enterprising young woman, operates a small business selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] together with her aunt. This helps Yesenia economically a great deal, because with the business income she is able to pay for her studies. They sell pupusas three times a week because on those days Yesenia gets out of class a little earlier, and the sales schedule is from 4:00 p.m. to 7:00 in the evening. 

She needs the loan in order to buy an industrial griddle for making pupusas, because the one she has is borrowed from a neighbor lady. That's why she needs to buy her own because it's the principal tool of her business.

Yesenia's dream is to graduate with a university degree and always keep up her business and pay for her studies.

loans.use: to buy a commercial grill to make pupusas [stuffed tortillas].

loans.name: Rendy

texts.en:
Mr. Rendy has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang City in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mr. Rendy heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in his vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mr. Rendy who is also a healthworker in  his neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in his area. 
This loan will allow Mr. Rendy to buy about 40 filters and sel them on to his neighbors on credit  making safe drinking water available to 200 people.

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to sell affordable Water Purifiers

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en: Neevone understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Neevone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Neevone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Neevone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: La Reine B Group

texts.fr: Bienvenue remercie kiva pour le soutien. Elle a pu faire son activité avec le prêt. Le groupe de Bienvenue a pu bien faire ses remboursements. Cette brave dame donne la formation à d'autres femmes sur la transformation. Elle a besoin d'un nouveau crédit pour continuer son activité qui est la transformation du sésame en caramel. Elle voudrait acheter du sésame stocker pour sa transformation.Elle envisage ouvrir un magasin de sésame et impliquer les membres de sa famille. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en: Bienvenue thanks Kiva for the support. She was able to operate her business through the loan. Her group was able to make its payments. This good and honest woman trained other women in this business. She needs a new loan to continue her business, which is the production of caramel from sesame. She would like to purchase sesame to stock up for her work. She envisions opening a sesame store and involving her family members. After making her sales, her profit will enable her to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds for food production and resale.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Yohanna has a family of two and lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Yohanna heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Yohanna who is also a leader of her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 
This loan will allow Mrs. Yohanna to buy 40 filters and sell them on consignment to her neighbors making safe drinking water available to 200 people

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Ipung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ipung is the mother of 3 children. She is lives in a town in Malang Regency in Java, Indonesia's most heavily populated island. In Indonesia, you cannot drink city water and most people don't even have access to piped water. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. Mrs. Ipung heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity. Mrs. Ipung who is also a leader of her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. 
This loan will allow Mrs. Ipung to buy 80 filters and sell them on consignment to her neighbors making safe drinking water available to 300 people

loans.use: To buy water filters in order to provide her neighbors with safe drinking water

loans.name: Kokoussé

texts.fr: Mr Kokoussé est marié à une revendeuse. Il est âgé de 28ans tous scolarisés. Il est aussi revendeur mais il vend des quincailleries. Il manque de fonds pour augmenter son stock et il sollicite de WAGES un montant pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Avec les profits, il veut agrandir son activité et assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. Kokoussé is married to a retailer. He is 28 years old. [All his children are in school.] He is also a retailer, but he sells hardware products. He lacks the funds for increasing his inventory, and he is requesting from WAGES an amount of money to stock up on merchandise. With the profits, he wants to expand his business and ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hardware products

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
BRAULIO TIEN 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE CUENTA CON 06 HIJOS DEPENDIENTE. EL Y SU FAMILIA VIVEN EN EL CASERIO DE BUENA VISTA ANEXO LA RINCONADA DEL DISTRITO DE SALLIQUE, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGION CAJAMARCA. EN DICHO CASERIO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO LA AGRICULTURA Y LA GANADERIA.

ÉL SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA, CUENTA CON UNA FINCA DE LIMA FRUTERA,COSECHA DE MANERA MENSUAL DICHOS PRODUCTOS, CUENTA CON MAS DE 15 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, TAMBIEN SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO DE PAN LLEVAR COMO MAIZ, YUCA , TRIGO PARA SU COSUMO,ADEMAS SE DESEMPEÑA COMO PEON AGRICOLA EN SU CASERIO Y CASERIOS CERCANOS,PRESENTA BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES.EL CREDITO SERÁ UTILIZADO EN COMPRA DE FERTILIZANTES PARA SU CULTIVO DE LIMA Y OTROS GASTOS PERSONALES, ESTO LE PERMITIRA GENERAR MAYORES INGRESOS Y MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Braulio is 43 years old. He has a partner and he has 6 children who depend on him. They live in the town of Buena Vista, next to La Rinconada, district of Sallique, province of Jaen, Cajamarca region. This is a town of farmers and ranchers.
He works in agriculture. He owns a lime fruit ranch, he harvests this product every month. He has more than 15 years of experience in this field. He also cultivates corn, yuca, wheat to make bread. He also works as a farm worker for other farms in his town and towns nearby. He has great personal and working references. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate lime and for other personal expenses, which will allow him to generate more income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate lime and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, esta adquiriendo mucha experiencia en el uso de créditos, su venta de medicinas continúa funcionando y con el financiamiento anterior surtió con nueva mercadería su inventario. Con las ganancias a podido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia e iniciado a criar cerdos y pollos para tener nuevos ingresos. Por el momento se mantiene saludable y no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar medicinas, ladrillo, sementó, láminas y otros materiales de construcción para mejorar las galeras en las que tiene ubicado a los animales. Espera tener resultados positivos como con el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Juana is acquiring much experience in the use of loans. Her sale of medicines continues functioning, and with the previous loan she stocked her inventory with new merchandise. With the earnings, she has been able to cover the basic necessities of her family. She has begun to raise pigs and chickens in order to have a new source of income. At this time, she is staying healthy and doesn't have any difficulties in the business.

She is applying for a new loan to purchase medicines, brick, cement, metal sheeting, and other construction materials in order to improve the galleries where she has located the animals. She hopes to have positive results, as she did with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy medicines, brick, cement, metal sheeting, and other construction materials to improve the galleries where she has located the animals

loans.name: Paspanga Djantoli Group

texts.fr: Fatimata, est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le groupe de Fatimata est à son 5ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et les remboursements se font à bonne date. Cette brave dame vend des draps et des nappes et cela fait 4 ans qu'elle fait ce commerce. Elle a besoin du crédit pour acheter des draps à 80 000 francs, des nappes à 50 000 francs et des tissus légers à 25 000 francs. Pour faire avancé son activité, Fatimata est très accueillante et guide ses clients dans leur choix, par moment, elle va même livré à la maison. Après ses ventes, les bénéfice de Fatimata lui permettra de continuer son activité et aussi de faire les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatimata is the official of the group. She is a marred mother of two. Her group is on its 5th loan contract with ACFIME, and payments are made on time. This good and honest woman has been selling bed sheets and table cloths for four years as a business. She has need of the loan to purchase bed sheets at 80,000 francs; table cloths at 50,000 francs; and some light-weight fabrics at 25,000 francs. 

To advance her business, Fatimata is very accommodating and guides her customers in making choices. At times, she even will make home deliveries. After making her sales, the profits will enable her to continue her business and also to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, table cloths, and light-weight fabrics to sell

loans.name: Trust And Obey Group

texts.en: Christabel is 55 years old. She is the leader and a group representative of Trust and Obey Group.  Christabel comes from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. Christabel is married with 5 children, 2 of the children are in school currently. She is a trader who sells plastic chairs, bowls , tables, mob and washroom cleaning accessories in the local market. She has been in her business for 35 years.  She has 1 employee whom she pays at the end of every month.  Christabel and her group members have been with the field partner for 6 years now. This is their  12th loan cycle.   They have good repayment records with their past 11 loan cycles.  Christabel wants to see more improvement in her business in the next five years in terms of growth. She is requesting for a loan to help her buy more plastic chairs, bowls, mobs and washroom accessories to resell. The loan will help her increase her stock to make more profit to reinvest into her business and support her husband and to cater for their 2 children in school and also improve the living conditions of the family.  Christabel thanks all her micro-lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, bowls, mops and washroom cleaning accessories

loans.name: Le Developpement Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAULINE est responsable du groupe LE DEVELOPPEMENT. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 18mois. 04 vont à l’école.Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz, 02cartons de lait.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne aider son mari avec la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. PAULINE is the official of the group LE DEVELOPPEMENT. A married woman, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 18 months old. Four go to school. She has four persons to support. 

Ms. PAULINE has been in the restaurant business for three years. She gets her supplies at the market in her district. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of rice and 2 boxes of milk. With the profits, she wants to bolster her business. Her ambition is to help her husband to cover the children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and 2 boxes of milk

loans.name: Akouassiwa

texts.fr: Cette dame a 40 ans, elle est mariée et a 03 enfants. Pour participer aux charges de sa famille elle fait le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé auprès des grossistes. elle revend ensuite dans sa boutique louée pour cet effet. Elle souhaite avoir une grande boutique et voir évoluer ses enfants sur le plan éducatif.
texts.en: This lady is 40 years old and married, and she has three children. To help cover family expenses, she does commerce in grocery items. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé from wholesalers. She then makes her sales in her shop leased for this purpose. She would like to have a large shop and to see her children advance in the educational arena.

loans.use: to purchase canned drinks

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has two daughters. One daughter lives separately. Another one lives with her husband at Oksana's apartment. 

Oksana works in a kindergarten. She loves her job. Due to previous KIVA loan Oksana bought new furniture for her apartment. This time Oskana is asking for a loan of 20 000 UAH to renovate two rooms in her apartment. She wants to put laminate on the floor as well as putty and paint the ceiling.

loans.use: to renovate two rooms in her apartment

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 26 years old and she manages a grocery store in her neighborhood. She lives with her parents and she is a single mother of one child. Nancy needs a loan to buy more products for her grocery store, She hopes you can help her because she is the only support at her house. Her parents are retired and Nancy needs to earn more money

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 21 years old and makes blankets she sells at fairs. Ana visits a lot of places to earn money. Ana is married and her husband works as a driver. They have their own house and with a lot of effort Ana purchased a vehicle that is driven by her husband.  Ana wants to help her husband so she needs a loan to buy an engine for her vehicle. Ana and her husband are healthy and they work hard so she hopes you can help her family more than her husband. Ana is the mother of one child and she is showing us one of her blankets in the picture.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her vehicle

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina de 55 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad, está bajo su responsabilidad, el otro trabaja y es mayor de edad y tiene familia propia. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para mantener los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de superación sigue luchando y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería y ropa nueva de forma ambulante,  tiene cinco años de dedicarse a dicha actividad la cual ha venido creciendo poco a poco y le ha permitido mantener los gastos económicos de su casa. El negocio consisten en vender ropa como: pantalones jens, camisetas, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, toallas, pantalón de vestir, vestidos, camisetas de mujer. El negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargo y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos, y cumplir sus sueños y metas como es  brindarles estudios a su hijo  y poder mejorar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que tiene serios problemas con la entrada del invierno,  y necesita brindarle seguridad a sus hijo menor. Saturnina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Saturnina, who is 55 years old, is a single mother with two children, of whom one is a minor and is her responsibility. The other one works, is an adult, and has his own family. She is characterized as being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she was not able to go to school and faced the necessity to work to support the household expense.

Thanks to her will to achieve, she continues striving and has for her business activity the sale of merchandise and new clothing as a street vendor. She has been working for five years in this activity, which has been growing little by little and has allowed her to support the economic expenses of her house.
