The business consists of selling clothing such as pants, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, nightwear, underwear, towels, dress pants, dresses, and women's t-shirts. She carries out her business as a street vendor, by order, and in her home. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling new clothing, so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income and accomplish her dreams and goals, such as offering an education to her son and being able to improve the roof of her house, since it has serious problems with the arrival of winter, and she needs to offer security to her younger son. 

Saturnina is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase and sell new clothing such as jeans, blouses, shorts, dresses, skirts, children's clothing, nightwear, underwear, towels, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria Natty

texts.es:
Gregoria continúa con su actividad de venta de comida, actualmente vive con su pareja.
El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios de cocina, como; ollas, cuchillos, sartenes y otros, que lograron mejorar su actividad y también sus ingresos. Las cuotas de su crédito fueron pagadas por adelantado porque no tuvo problemas, ¨el precio de la comida que oferto es accesible por eso es que tengo clientes continuos y ventas diarias…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas, la desventaja son los días de lluvia porque las ventas bajan. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina, como: papa, chuño, arroz, fideo y un refrigerador para carne. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Gregoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina y un refrigerador para carne para continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues to work in her food sales business; she now lives with her partner.
With the former loan she invested in kitchen utensils like pots, frying pans, knives and other items, which achieved an improvement in her business and her income. The payments of her loan were completed ahead of time because she had no problems. "The price of the food I offer is affordable and that's why I have constant customers and daily sales," she says. 
The advantage of her business is constant sales, the disadvantage is rainy days because sales fall. Her dream is to open a restaurant; she wants to accomplish the purchase of kitchen provisions like: potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, rice, noodles, and a meat refrigerator. This is her second sequential loan in the four years she has operated her own food sales business.
That's why Gregoria is requesting a loan in order to buy kitchen provisions and a meat refrigerator in order to continue building her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen provisions and a meat refrigerator to continue improving her business.

loans.name: Doña Lidia Group

texts.es: Grupo Doña Lidia está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día para salir adelante y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es el octavo ciclo que solicitan crédito en ADIM y el grupo está coordinado por María Elena una mujer laboriosa de 28 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella es propietaria de una pulpería en su comunidad desde hace tres años donde ofrece una amplia variedad de productos, uno de los logros obtenidos con el crédito anterior fue la construcción de un cuarto, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, avena, jabón, papel higiénico, la segunda socia es Sandra de 37 años quien se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos, refrescos y piñatas, la tercer socia María de 40 años propietaria de una pulpería desde hace seis años.
texts.en: Doña Lidia group is composed by three business women who work every day to get ahead and provide a future for their children. This is their eight cycle of loans with ADIM. This group is coordinated by María Elena. She is a 28-year-old hard-working woman with two children who are her motivation. She's owned a grocery store in her community for three years. She sells a large variety of products. One of her achievements reached with these loans was to build a room. She is asking for this loan to buy basic grains, oild, oats, soap, toilet paper. The second member, Sandra, 37, sells backed beans, sodas and pinatas. The third member, Maria, 40, has owned a grocery store for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, oats, soap, toilet paper.

loans.name: Fredielyn

texts.en:
Fredielyn is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Fredielyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Fredielyn has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Fredielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. Shirley is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

Shirley has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 49 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ritchel requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ritchel has been raising pig for 17 years and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 34 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school, Christina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional can goods such as eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Christina has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Christina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional can goods such as eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 54 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rosemarie has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Romero

texts.en:
Romero needs a loan to buy another dairy cow. He is working hard but he realizes that he needs more cows to improve his income. Romero is healthy. He is single and he is helping his parents. He lives with them. Romero is also working as an electrician assistant, but the money he makes is not enough. He hopes you can help him again. 

Romero would like to live independently. He hopes you can help him to achieve his goal

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla works hard to support her family. Perla is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Perla has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Perla would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 43 years old and married with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Teresa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase stocks of household goods to sell.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Kpangmanga - Bagurugu Group

texts.en: Arishetu is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She is a member of a shea nut and butter processing group called ‘Kpangmanga, Bagurugu’ in the northern region of Ghana. Arishetu is the individual sitting in front with the hand raised. Her group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium shea nuts and butter for the local and export markets. Arishetu enjoys doing her business and has requested for a loan of GHS 12,500.00 together with her group. Her share of the loan is GHS 500.00, which she would use to buy shea nuts for processing. Arishetu wants to earn more income to repay the loan and support her family. Arishetu is thankful to Kiva lenders for their life changing support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Wunpini, Pishigu No.2 Group

texts.en: Fuseina is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She is a member of a shea nut and butter processing group called ‘Wumpini, Pishigu #2’ in the northern region of Ghana. Fuseina is the individual squatting in the middle with the hand raised. Her group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process premium shea nuts and butter for the local and export markets. Fuseina earns good profit from her business and together with her group, have requested for a loan of GHS 6,800.00. Her own share of the loan is GHS 300.00, which she would use to buy shea nuts for processing. Fuseina wants to earn more income to payback the loan and cater for her children. Fuseina is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tamarindo, barley, oranges and other fruit as well as beans and firewood.

loans.name: Aneolina

texts.en:
Aneolina is 41 years old and married with two children, who are in school, Aneolina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Aneolina has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Aneolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Boniebee

texts.en:
Ma. Boniebee is 25 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Boniebee has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sanielve

texts.en:
Sanielve works hard to support her family. Sanielve is single with one child and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Sanielve requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products.

Sanielve has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and personal care products

loans.name: Candelaria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su esposo es carpintero y tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia.

Carmen, es una persona con muchos deseos de superación, inicio a vender verduras a la edad de 15 años, despues empezó a trabajar como ama de casa, siempre continua trabajando y ahora cuida a dos niños y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. además con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar ganado y con ayuda de su esposo lograron criarlos y venderlos, para tener otra fuente de ingresos adicional.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado de repasto, de esta forma continuar teniendo una fuente de ingresos adicional.

Carmen, tiene el sueño de mejorar su vivienda y le gustaría aprender el oficio de cosmetología.
texts.en:
Carmen, 41, finished 7th grade. She is married with 3 three children and only one of them is currently in school. Her husband is a carpenter.
Carmen has a strong will for self-improvement. She started selling vegetables when she was 15 years old. She later on started working as a home maker. She's worked ever since and she's currently working as a nanny from 7 to 4. Also, with a lot of hard work, she's been able to buy cattle and with the help of her husband they've been able to raise them and sell them, to have an additional source of income.
She needs this loan to buy grazing cattle, and to continue having this additional source of income.
Carmen's dream is to make improvements to her home and she would like to become a cosmetologist.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Martha Ivania

texts.es:
Martha Ivania, madre soltera con tres hijos dos mayores  de edad, y un menor de edad, es originaria de  Managua, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar y se ve en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los  gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha, día a día para salir adelante con su negocio y en la manutención de su familia.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica, la vta. de productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jugos, frijoles, maíz, productos magi, salsa de tomates, producto enlatados, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, fósforos, cigarros, etc. Tiene diez años de desempeñarse en dicha actividad, y la tiene ubicada en uno de los mercados de la localidad, la rutina de trabajo de esta madre soltera es de unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para aumentar su clientela, darle buen servicio al cliente, y obtener mejores ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles como,  Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y pises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha Ivania is a single mother of three, one of them a minor. She was born in Managua. She is hard-working, responsible and has a strong will for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to lack of resources she couln't go to school and she had the need to work to help cover her household expenses. Today, she struggles every day to improve her business and to support her family.
Thanks to her determination, she has a source of income, she sells products such as rice, sugar, milk, juice, beans, corn, Maggi products, tomato sauce, banned goods, sodas, crackers, matches, cigarrettes and others.. She's been working in the field for 10 years and she is located in one of the markets in the city. The routine of this single mother includes working for 10 hours a day offering her products to increase her customer base. She provides a good service and she works to obtain a better income in the near future. The goal of this loan is to invest it in work capital and to stock her business with a variety of edibles. Martha is thankful for the help from her Kiva lenders who lend a hand to low income people and to countries like Nicaragua to find decent work.

loans.use: to buy edibles such as rice, sugar, milk, juice, corn, Maggi products, tomato sauce and canned goods.

loans.name: Wendlamita Group

texts.fr: le groupe Wendlamita est à son 4ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et jusque là, les remboursements se font correctement. Clémentine est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Cette brave dame préparer du gonré pour vendre et cela fait 10 ans. Le gonré c'est un plat burkinabé qui est fait à base du haricot, du mil, et des feuilles et est très consommé. Cette dame, âgée de 50 ans a besoin du prêt pour acheter sa matière première pour préparer divers sortes de gonré pour vendre. Elle a des commandes lors des mariages, des baptêmes et autre cérémonie et cela fait avance son activité. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra d'augmenter le volume de son activité et aussi s'occuper de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wendlamita group is on its fourth group loan with ACFIME. So far the group members have been making their payments on time. Clémentine is the group's leader. She is married and has seven children. This hard-working woman has been selling her homemade "gonré" [a traditional dish]  for 10 years. "Gonré" is a  prepared on the basis of beans, millet and  herbs which is very popular in Burkina Faso. 

Clémentine, who is 50 years old, needs this loan to stock up on ingredients needed to cook gonré for sale. She takes catering orders for weddings, baptisms and other celebrations, which advances her business. The revenue she will earn through her sales will allow her to expand her business and also take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, millet and herbs needed to cook a traditional dish for sale.

loans.name: Rieb

texts.en: Rieb is 51 years old, living in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district and the mother of four children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family's condition via rice farming and piglet raising. Having been in these businesses for 33 years, she can earn around 25,600 KHR per day and she is able to save about 5,000 KHR each day after offsetting her daily expenses. Her crops being destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her farming business. This is the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund. Rieb is going to use the entire loan to spend on buying fertilizers and plowing the rice fields. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more rice crop yields so as to upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to spend on buying fertilizers and plowing the rice fields

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old, married to Bathsheba and he supports five family members.

He has been a keeper of livestock such as goats for the last 13 years and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate himself.

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients daily and meet their demand in milk supply.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a businesswoman who earns income through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to aid in renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for building.

loans.name: Kelvin Rolando

texts.es:
Kelvin Rolando tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo en el caserío de Puente Techin en el Distrito de Pucará, que pertenece a la Provincia de Jaén, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Kelvin Rolando es la de brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda servicio,con mas de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, además también se dedica a realizar labores como peón agrícola, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo lo va invertir en arreglos y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil de esta manera podrá asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de la misma y por ende le permitirá seguir generando ingresos, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kelvin Rolando is 25 years old and in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his partner and son, who is a minor, in the village of Puente Techin, in the district of Pucará, which belongs to the province of Jaén, located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Kelvin Rolando’s business is offering public transportation services.  He has his own moto-taxi, with which he offers services, and he has over five years of experience in this line of work.  He also works as an agricultural labor.  He has very good personal and work references.  He will invest the loan in repairs and maintenance of his vehicle.  This way, he will be able to ensure that it functions correctly, and that will allow him to keep generating profit.  In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more employees

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy and his family live in a rural home in Mugwe village in Kenya. His wife and two children love dairy and poultry farming for the milk and eggs they get. Timothy started farming 11 years ago and now he has four cows and about 1300 heads of poultry. He sells raw milk and eggs at the local market and uses the income to cover domestic and business expenses.

Through hard work and sacrifices, he has been able to grow his dairy farm over the years. He is seeking a loan to further grow his business. The borrowed money will be used to buy materials for completing construction of the roof of his cowshed. Having a complete cowshed will not only create an ideal environment for his animals but also pave way for the introduction of confined grazing, which has proved to boost the animals ability to increase milk production.

Your loan investment will help Timothy get more milk, increase his income and elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Iesha

texts.en: Iesha has an extensive background in early childhood education. After being a teacher for over seven years, Iesha decided it was time to start her own business. Iesha is the proud owner of Kids of Distinction Christian Learning Academy, LLC.  Iesha has been in business for one month and has a staff of three; she employs two full-time teachers and one part-time employee.  As a newly formed start-up, Iesha needs equipment and supplies to help with the daily operations of her academy.  She also wants to hire another part-time employee to create a well-rounded team.  With her loan, Iesha will not only be able to fund her dreams, she will be able to help parents within her community give their children a place to learn and grow.

loans.use: To pay for payroll and working capital

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique came to the United States from Cuba as a refugee three years ago. He received a bachelor’s degree in IT and Computer Repair in Cuba and has worked in this field for over 10 years. 

Enrique feels as though his work is continuing a family legacy. He recalls that as a child, he used to watch his grandfather fixing typewriters in his workshop. Since then, Enrique's passion for electronics and hardware has grown. 

Enrique began Yiyo’s Computers in 2014 after working at a local computer repair and IT company. Yiyo’s Computers repairs and builds computers, installs software and sells products. Yiyo’s Computers’ diversified offerings give Enrique a competitive advantage in a market with such high demand.  

Enrique will be using his $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase inventory in the form of computer parts and supplies. The new inventory will allow Enrique to expand his home-based business and increase his capacity to service more customers. 

Since starting his business, Enrique has grown his customer base. He continues to market his business through business cards, a website and the wrap around advertising on his car. Enrique is also taking classes to receive several IT certifications that will increase his marketability and help him to stay up-to-date on his expertise. 

In the future, Enrique hopes to grow his customer base and expand his business to a store front location where he can store more equipment.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 15.4 hectáreas de las cuales 5.6 son de café. En los últimos 3 años ha venido incrementando su producción de café de manera significativa, producto del adecuado manejo que ha dado a sus plantaciones.

El control de plagas y enfermedades es uno de los mayores retos de este productor, por ello ha desarrollado un plan de mejoramiento nutricional que implementará de manera gradual, requiriendo para este ciclo un financiamiento para adquirir los abonos y fertilizantes que le ayudarán a incrementar su producción en un 20% y con ellos los ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor es potenciar los recursos con los que cuenta y dar a su familia mejores condiciones, lo cual está seguro podrá lograr haciendo este tipo de inversiones.
texts.en:
Julio is a grower in the northern zone of Nicaragua.  His farm is 15.4 hectares in size, and 5.6 of these grow coffee.  In the last three years, his coffee production has been growing significantly.  This is a product of the appropriate management he has employed in his fields.

Pest control and disease control are some of the biggest challenges for this grower.  Therefore, he has developed a nutritional improvement plan which he will implement gradually.  For this season, he needs funding to acquire the compost and fertilizer that will help him increase his production by 20%, and with that increase his income for his family.

This small grower’s dream is to strengthen the resources he has and give his family better conditions.  He is certain he can achieve this by making this type of investments.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer, which he will apply to his coffee plantation to have greater production.

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
The Warna Sari group was able to pay off their loan on time. During the past six months, the group succeeded in maintaining their pigs. Besides being controlled by the Loan Officer, they were also visited by the Vet regularly. That way, the pigs grew well and they were sold for a good price.

Luh, as the head, is responsible for the group and the repayment. She is a piglet seller. Her sow had 10 healthy piglets. She sold them all. After deducting the cost of feed and the payment to MUK, she earned a satisfactory profit. She’s very happy for that, and she hopes that with the next loan, she earns more to improve her business.

The Warna Sari group is located in north Bali, near the Pemuteran beach, which is one of the tourist destinations in Bali. Although most inhabitants there work as a fishermen or farmers, as Balinese women, they still maintain the culture of raising pigs to support the family's income. Luh has two children and her husband work as a farmer.

She will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets and feed. She plans to manage her pig fattening, in addition to the sow she still has. She hopes the price of pigs remains high and she can earn a satisfactory profit.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabrics to sew and resell

loans.name: Eufracio

texts.en: Eufracio is 63 years old and married with children. He lives in Dipolog. Since birth, Eufracio has been a farmer. He earns 5,000 PHP each month. Eufracio is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell in her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her hair salon

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en: Hermenegilda is 59 years old, single and a businesswoman in Dipolog. She has her buy and sell business, which helps her family to sustain their needs. She is also a member of PMPC where she was granted a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase items for selling. Hermenegilda is hoping to have an extended area for her business.

loans.use: To purchase items for selling

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 58 years old and living in Dipolog-Zamboanga del Norte. She has a sari-sari store where she has generated income for almost six years. Divina is a member of PMPC. She availed a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Divina hopes to sustain her business in her area.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Felicisima tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Felicisima was loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Felicisima looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Joenila

texts.en:
Joenila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Joenila has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Joenila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase telephones and accessories to resell

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato has been a member of PMPC since 2011. He is currently seeking a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house. 

Renato is hoping to have a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Ongezwa

texts.en:
Ongezwa is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is her story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am doing a Bachelor of Art in Business Administration. I enjoy Marketing Management and Business Strategy.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After I have finished my degree, I would like to have my own company. I would like to work in Gauteng province. Johannesburg is my favorite city that I would like to work in. I like to travel to learn more things in my country and outside South Africa.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born In Baragranath Hospital but I was raised at Eastern Cape in Umtata Qunu location. I have two sisters and three brothers, but I am the first of the five siblings. My father passed away on 2003 June. My mother is a domestic worker at Qunu but she works 3 days in a week. I am married in customary marriage, we did not sign at home affairs and have two children, boys, my first born was born in 2000 and last born on 2010.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like reading newspapers and books. I also teach old people how to write and read in my community because I am a very passionate person who likes helping other people. I am also helping primary school children with their home –works.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva loan will make a difference in my life because my husband is not working for a period of seven months. My mother is the one who gives me money so that I can be able to come to school every day. Things would be better if I could get the loan. I am the first born in the family to have furthered my studies; kiva would play a big role so that I can continue with my studies and change my family’s situation.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Tiendemeton Group

texts.en:
Korotoumou is the one holding the sheep’s rope among the members of the group. She is a housewife, aged 49, and she supports four children, of whom one is in elementary school. Korotoumou has been a livestock farmer of sheep for over six years. This business enables her to support her children. 

She has turned to RMCR for financing and improving her sheep-raising business. She is very wise and gets her supplies from the nearby markets. After a few months of keeping her sheep, feeding them, and providing veterinary care, she resells them at the same markets. She would like to improve her children’s basic education and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise

loans.name: Osver

texts.es:
Osver tiene 22 años de edad , SOLTERO, con ningún hijo a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de OYOTUN, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte Perú. Esta es una zona rural.

Osver se dedica a brindar servicio de chofer , hace 01 año, negocio se encuentra ubicado en Oyotun; solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; crédito lo esta destinando para curso de manejo y capacitación vehicular, con la finalidad de dar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros, por lo mismo que verá un mayor volumnes de ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Osver is 22 years old. He is single, with no children, lives at home in the district of Oyotun, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo, region Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru. This is a rural zone. Osver has worked as a driver for the past 1 year. The business is located in Oyotun. He is asking for  a loan to invest in his work capital. The loan will be used for a driving course and vehicular education, his goal is to give a better service to his passengers, which will result in greater income and improvement in his quality of life.

loans.use: take a driving course and vehicular education.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza es una mujer laboriosa de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla, carne asada y productos Avon desde hace 17 años, su hija y esposo le ayuda a distribuir los pedidos Avon a los clientes, es el cuarto ciclo que solicita financiamiento en ADIM, con el crédito anterior logró mejorar la cocina de su casa. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz, leña, carne, perfumes y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 42 year old hard working woman who is married and a mother to three children.  She has worked selling tortillas, roast meat and Avon products for 17 years.  Her daughter and husband help her distributing the Avon orders to their clients.  

This is the fourth cycle that she has requested a loan with ADIM.  With the previous loan she was able to improve the kitchen in her home.  This credit is to buy corn, firewood, meat, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, meat, perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Concepcion Estenia

texts.es:
Concepción, de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales solo uno está estudiando.

Concepción, toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en agricultura, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y gracias a ellos aprendió a realizar esta actividad.- Actualmente, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y también tiene crianza de ganado, cerdos y pollos; todo esto lo hace con ayuda de su esposo y 2 de sus hijos.

El préstamo sera invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para poder sembrar maíz.

Concepción, sueña con tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepción is 47 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She is married, with 4 children, of which only one is currently studying. Concepcion has worked in agriculture all of her life, her parents were farmers and thanks to them she learned to work in this field. Currently, she grows 7,000 m2 of corn and also raises cattle, pigs and chickens. She does all of this with her husband and two of her children. The loan will be invested to buy agricultural product such as manure, pesticide and herbicides to be able to grow corn. Concepcion dreams of having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products such as manure, peticides, and herbicides to be able to grow corn.

loans.name: Geones School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Agnes. She is the Director of Geones Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mbale with 300 students. Geones School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Geones School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Agnes ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.en:
Constantino is looking to have a comfortable house to live in. He has been a PMPC member since 2007. 

He has taken a loan of PHP 20,000 to support his housing renovations. He will use the loan to purchase roof sheets, plywood and nails.

loans.use: for housing renovations.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Raquel es una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación, casada y madre de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante en la vida, ella es propietaria de una pulpería donde ofrece a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, crema y pan.  Es el tercer ciclo que solicita crédito en ADIM, con los créditos anteriores logro comprar una vitrina que le ha servido para mostrar productos  y una mantenedora, que le sirvió para vender todo tipo de bebidas refrescantes.
texts.en:
Raquel is an enterprising woman with a great desire to improve her life.  She is married and mother of two children, who are her major motivation to get ahead in life.  

She is the proprietor of a local convenience store where she offers clients a wide variety of products.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, cream and bread.  This is the third cycle in which she is requesting credit with ADIM.  With previous loans she was able to buy a display cabinet which has helped her to display products, and a fridge which has helped her to sell all types of refreshing drinks.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, cream and bread

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is married and for the last seven years has worked hard selling fish to earn an income. She has applied for a 24,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Her goal is to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra, de 50 años de edad, no estudio, está casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene cuatro hijos y solo uno de ellos estudia.

Sandra, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 10 años, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y la llevaban para que les ayudara con el trabajo en las fincas cafetaleras.- También, trabajo realizando oficios domésticos y después que se casó continuo trabajando en la agricultura junto a su esposo, actualmente siembran 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde sembrara maíz.

El sueño de Sandra, es aprender a leer y escribir; además le gustaría mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Sandra is 50 years old. She didn't study, she is married and her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children and only one studies. Sandra started working at the age of 10. Her parents were farmers, and they took her with them to help with the work in the coffee farms. She also worked as a domestic worker and after she got married she continued to work in agriculture along with her husband. Currently they have 7,000 m2 of corn and beans. The loan will be invested to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for the rent of the lot where she will grow corn. Sandra's dream is to learn to write and read, she will also would like to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and to pay the rent for the lot where she will grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up with new clothing designs, details, perfumes and other

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Adama est la personne qui a la corde du bœuf sur la Photo. Adama est âgée de 34 ans. Il habite au Mali  avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans. Parmi ses enfants 3 sont à l’école.  Il exerce son activité d’embouche de bœuf il y'a 6 ans de cela. Adama  achète des bœufs maigres au marché hebdomadaire  de N’Togonasso, les traite, nourrit  et  les revend en Côte-D’Ivoire. Les  autres membres du groupe exercent  le même  métier de bœufs. Adama a pris de l’argent  pour augmenter  son activité d’embouche. Avec ce prêt il rêve d’avoir un nombre  de bétails plus important. Ce prêt  l’aidera à répondre aux besoins de sa famille : la santé de ses enfants, la scolarité des enfants  et pus de bœufs en son propre nom dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Adama is the person holding the ox's tether on the photo. He is 34 years old, and lives in Mali with his wife and five children whose ages range from one to ten years. Three of the children attend school.

He has been fattening oxen for the past six years. Adama buys lean cattle at the weekly market in N'Togonasso, treats and feeds them, and resells them in Ivory Coast. The other group members are in the same cattle business.

Adama got the money to increase his fattening activity, and is hoping to use this loan to obtain a larger number of cattle. This loan will help him meet his family's needs: his children's health and their schooling, and more oxen under his own name in coming days.

loans.use: buy oxen for resale

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José Esteban es un pequeño productor de 37 años de edad que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Se dedica a la caficultura como principal actividad económica desde hace 4 años y su finca es manejada bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E Practices.

Para seguir mejorando la productividad de su finca, él está solicitando un crédito para este año, que le permita comprar los insumos y abonos que requiere su cafetal. Su meta es contar con una finca modelo en unos cinco años, donde cuente con una mayor cosecha de café para darle a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Jose Esteban is a small producer who is 37 years old and  lives in a community north of Nicaragua. He has worked in coffee production as his main economic activity for 4 years and his farm is managed under the criteria of fair trade certification,UTZ and C.A.F.E practices.

To continue improving the productivity of his farm, he is requesting a loan for this year, which allows him to purchase inputs and fertilizers required by his coffee plantation.  

His goal is to have a model farm in about five years, where he might achieve a bigger coffee harvest and hence provide his family with better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers which will allow him to achieve a good coffee harvest

loans.name: Gneta Group

texts.fr:
Tenant en main la corde du Bœuf, Katié est un cultivateur  âgé de 36 ans qui habite au mali.
Très engagé dans ses travaux, il vit avec sa femme ménagère de son état  et ses quatre enfants âgés de 1 à 11 ans dont deux écoliers. Dans l’avenir il envisage d’aider ses enfants à atteindre leurs objectifs sur le plan scolaire. Il fait recourt au RMCR pour financer  son activité de l’embouche qu’il mène depuis près de 8 ans.  Il utilise son prêt pour acheter les animaux affaiblis (Bœufs).Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses produits dans ses mêmes marchés. Il se réjouit beaucoup de fait qu’il arrive à financer l’étude de ses enfants et leurs matériels de transport.
texts.en:
Holding in his hand the ox's tether, Katie is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in Mali.

Very involved in his work, he lives with his housekeeping wife and their four children aged one to 11 years old, including two schoolchildren. In the future he plans to help his children achieve their academic goals.

He calls upon the RMCR to finance the fattening activity he has led for nearly eight years. He uses his loan to buy weakened animals (oxen). He buys in the surrounding markets and sells his products in the same markets.

He welcomes the fact that he manages to finance his children's studies and their means of transportation.

loans.use: buy oxen for resale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 55 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Rosalie has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, and chips

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 34 years old and married with four children. She invests her time in her retailing business. Through her business, she generates income and sustains the needs of her family. Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC since the year 2014. Recently, she availed a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Lilibeth is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

Cecil has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Cecil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 16 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn lives in Dipolog and supports her children by building houses from the ground up. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy building material and paint, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work that she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paint and pay her workers

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 45 years old and married with 10 children. Five of her children are sent to school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Morita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Morita has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell.

Analou has been in this business for four years.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell

loans.name: Elsis Xiomara

texts.es:
Elsis, de 27 años de edad, estudio enfermería en la universidad, actualmente está acompañada y tiene un hijo, su pareja trabaja como mecánico en un taller de reparación de autos.

Elsis, trabaja como enfermera en una clínica privada desde hace 6 años, gana salario mínimo; antes también tenía una pequeña tienda, pero por motivos de tiempo no siguió con el negocio, ahora volverá a colocarla nuevamente, ya que los ingresos como enfermera no cubren todas las necesidades y gastos del hogar.

El dinero de este crédito será para comprar productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, leche, pan, café, jabón, etc, todo para surtir el negocio nuevamente y tener satisfechos a sus clientes, ya que ahora trabaja solo por horas y tendrá más tiempo para atender el negocio y también le ayudara su madre.

El sueño de Elsis, es poder darle a su hijo una educación plena, para que se desarrolle profesionalmente y tenga una vida digna.
texts.en:
Elsis is 27 years old and studied nursing at university. She has a partner – a mechanic at an auto-repair shop – and one son.

Elsis has been working as a nurse at a private clinic for six years; she earns minimum wage. Elsis used to have a small shop but, owing to lack of time, she could not continue with this business. Now Elsis would like to re-open her shop as her income from nursing does not pay for all household necessities.

This loan will be used to buy staple goods such as rice, beans, milk, bread, coffee and soap in order to stock up Elsis’ business, and to keep customers satisfied. Elsis now works different hours as a nurse so she will have time to take care of the business; she will also receive help from her mother.

Elsis’ dream is to give her son a full education so that he may become a professional and have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, beans, milk, bread, coffee and soap.

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es:
Juan Orlando tiene 39 años y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace más de diez años, la caficultura es la principal actividad económica de esta familia, rubro que maneja bajo los estándares de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Su producción ha venido incrementando en los últimos tres años, lo cual pretende mantener en los próximos ciclos y para ello está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los abonos que requiere su cafetal para asegurar una buena cosecha y mejores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor es aumentar la productividad de su finca y lograr darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Orlando is 39 years old and lives with his three children in a community in the north of Nicaragua. For more than ten years, coffee production has been the main work for Juan’s family. He carries out this work under Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practices conditions.

Juan’s coffee production has increased in the last three years, which he hopes to maintain in the next few cycles. So as to do this, Juan is applying for a loan so that he can buy manure to apply to his coffee cops in order to have a good harvest and earn a higher income for his family.

Juan’s dream is to increase production and to give his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure to apply to his coffee cops in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es: El grupo "La iglesia", esta conformados por 3 mujeres emprendedoras y trabajadoras. La líder del grupo es Sadia, de 32 años, soltera, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos como cosméticos, perfumes, colonias, cremas, blusas, pantalones, camisas y blusas. Las otras socias son Rosario de 45 años, ella prepara y vende tortillas desde hace 12 años  y Gilma de 57 años se dedica a la venta de comida y también a la agricultura.
texts.en:
The “La Iglesia” group has three enterprising and hard-working women as members.

The group’s leader is 32-year-old Sadia, who is single. She currently makes a living selling cosmetics and new clothes. Sadia is applying for a loan in order to buy products, such as cosmetics, perfumes, colognes, creams, blouses, trousers, shirts and blouses.

The other members of this group are 45-year-old Rosario who has been preparing and selling tortillas for 12 years; and Gilma, 57, who makes a living selling meals and also working in farming.

loans.use: to buy products, such as cosmetics, perfumes, colognes, creams, blouses, trousers, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin tiene 49 años de edad vive en casa de material rústico con su cónyugue sin carga familiar,en el distrito de Querocotillo que pertenece a la provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte del Perú.

Él se dedica al cultivo de café, hace más de 15 años, cultivos de pan llevar, cría de ganado y a las labores de peón agrícola, cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. El destino del crédito es la inversión en labores de mantenimiento, poda y abono de su cultivo de café, esto le permitirá generar mayores ingresos, mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 49 years old and lives in a house built with rustic materials. Benjamin lives with his partner, but they do not have any other relatives to look after. The couple live in Querocotillo district, in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region in Peru’s northern highlands.

Benjamin has been making a living growing coffee for more than 15 years, as well growing other crops that bring bread. Benjamin also raises cattle and works as a farm labourer. He has very good professional and personal references in his community. 

This loan will be used to pay maintenance costs, and to buy manure for his coffee crops. This will allow Benjamin to earn a higher income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay maintenance costs, and to buy manure for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба молодая девушка, родом из района Шахритус. Она замужем и уже воспитывает своих детей. Махбуба с мужем живут вместе со свекром и свекровью. Махбуба планирует начать новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Она будет продавать детскую одежду. Некоторое время назад она занималась этой деятельностью, но с рождением детей и замужества она оставила бизнес и принялась за уходом детей. Теперь у Махбубы есть возможность возобновить деятельность. Она уже нашла торговую точку на базаре и ей остается только купить первый товар. Ее собственных средств не позволяют ей приобрести детскую одежду, и она обратилась за финансовой поддержкой с надеждой на одобрения.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a young woman from the Shahrituz district. She is married and already raising her children. Mahbuba and her husband live together with her husband's parents. Mahbuba is planning to start a new business in a retail field. She will be selling children's clothing. She was involved in this business for some time before, but with the marriage and the birth of her children, she left her business to take care of the children. Now, Mahbuba is able to restart her business. She has already found a retail outlet at a market and still has to buy her first merchandise. She does not have her own means to buy the children's clothing and requested financial support, hoping to get approved.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and start her own retail business

loans.name: Ana Hernesa

texts.en:
Ana Hernesa is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Hernesa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ana Hernesa has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rodelina

texts.en:
Rodelina is 22 years old and has two children.
Rodelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodelina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.
Rodelina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Rodelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jekabaara Group

texts.fr:
Madou est un cultivateur âgé de 37 ans qui réside au mali.
Assi avec un sac blanc  dans la main, il vit au  Mali avec sa femme ménagère  et ses quatre  enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans dont un écolier. Dans l’avenir, son rêve est d’approvisionner son habitat en eau potable et électricité.  Il fait recourt au RMCR  pour financer son activité de stockage de céréales  et de commerce des denrées alimentaires  qu’il pratique depuis dix ans. Il utilise son prêt pour acheter  ses sacs de céréales  (Mil, Maïs, Haricots, Riz, Sorghos, arachides). Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses produits dans ses mêmes marchés. Il se réjouit de cette activité de fait qu’il arrive à satisfaire ses besoins en nourriture.
texts.en:
Madou is a 37-year-old farmer who lives in Mali. Sitting with a white bag in his hand, he lives with his housekeeping wife and four children aged one to 14 years, of whom one attends school.

In the future his dream is to supply his home with drinking water and electricity. He calls upon RMCR to finance his grain storage and food product sales activities he has practiced over the past ten years.

He uses his loan to buy sacks of grain (millet, corn, beans, rice, sorghum, groundnuts). He resupplies in surrounding markets and sells his products in the same markets. He welcomes this activity because it enables him to meet his food requirements.

loans.use: buy bags of cereals for resale

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
After six months of maintenance fattening two pigs, Ni Kadek successfully sold them for 4,600,000 IDR. After deducting her spending on feed and medicines, the net benefit was 1,000,000 IDR. Now, the price of pork suddenly decreased from 34,000 IDR per kg to 22,000 IDR per kg.
Thanks to this, Ni Kadek paid off the 1,500,000 IDR loan to MUK and then she and the group of Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah requested a new loan from MUK.
These loans are necessary to increase business capital of pigs, so they can supplement their family income.
Ni Kadek and some friends formed a group of pigs that has been running for 10 periods. With the help of venture capital loans from MUK of 1,500,000 IDR per member, Ni Kadek establish a pigs group of Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah, and she became its leader.
Furthermore, Ni Kadek will use this loan to buy three local piglets for a pig barbeque. Ni Kadek will buy feed with her own money. Ni Kadek hopes that for next six months the pigs will have a good growth that will increase sales results.
Obviously the results obtained will be used to meet the cost of living as well as their children's school fees. Support from her husband also encouraged Ni Kadek to work hard with the pig livestock business. One member couldn’t attend the meeting because of sickness.

loans.use: to buy three local piglets for a pig barbeque

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 42 years old and married.
Aurora is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Aurora requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.
Aurora has been in this business for 12 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: 27 летняя женщина Фарангис из Шахритус. Она шустрая, умная и  замужем. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Дочка ходит в школе, а сынок ходит в садик. Муж занимается таксистом Душанбе - Шахритус. Фарангис не хочет сидеть дома без работ, и решила заниматься бизнесом. Она хочет зарабатывать и помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Фарангис планирует арендовать точку для продажи детскую одежду. Ей надо оплатить арендную точку и перевозить детскую одежду. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Фарангис просит займы. Она нуждается на финансовой поддержке. В будущем Фарангис хочет стать хорошим, опытным бизнес-леди.
texts.en: 27-year-old Farangis is from Shahrituz. She is quick-witted, smart and married. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter attends a school, and son attends a kindergarten. Her husband is a taxi driver on the Dushanbe - Shahrituz route. Farangis does not want to stay home without work and decided to start a business. She wants to earn money and help her husband provide for the family. Farangis plans to lease a space to sell children's clothing. She needs to pay for the retail outlet lease and bring in children's clothing. Farangis is requesting this loan due to the lack of her own funds. She needs financial support. Farangis wants to become a good, experienced business lady in the future.

loans.use: to start her own business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She runs two small enterprises, a “sari-sari” or variety store and a Piso Net. Her variety store sells various commodities like canned goods, candies, chips, biscuits, sachets of shampoo and conditioner, packs of condiments and spices, and many others. 

Piso Net is a coin-operated internet PC with typical rental fee of PHP 1 every four minutes. It is a budget-friendly internet café suitable for short time internet users. Her income from these businesses can help provide for their everyday needs. But her children are still studying in college, thus she plans to add another additional enterprise. 

She is a trained sewer or dressmaker and she wants to harness this talent. She intends to buy a sewing machine so she can sew some ready-to-wear clothes while she looks after her variety store and Piso Net. A hardworking mother indeed! She can exert all efforts just to provide for her children’s needs and education and give them better life someday. In due time, she dreams of having a bigger store, more PCs for Piso Net, and a ready-to-wear production business. 

She is hoping that you can contribute and help her take some steps towards achieving her dreams through a loan assistance of PHP 45,000 that she will use to buy a sewing machine. This loan will make her more productive. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine as an additional income-generating venture.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anita is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Anita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of used clothing to sell.

Anita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosell

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosell works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosell is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Rosell has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en:
Belenda is a widow woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Belenda is 45 years old and has one child who is in school.

Belenda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Belenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

Belenda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Belenda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma works hard to support her family. Delma is married and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Delma requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional hot dogs, tocino, embutidos and other things to sell.

Delma has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hot dogs, tocino, embotidos and other things to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
In the Philippines, “sari-sari” stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a Filipino term for variety) stores sell different products like biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and many other items that are needed in an individual’s daily life. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people since it provides commodities for people.

Susan was enticed to run this kind of enterprise. She is 55 years old, married with children, and a resident of Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. Her income from the store helps provide for their daily expenditures. However, due to competition in this kind of business, her income has become unstable. Hence, she plans to add alternative businesses like mineral water distribution and rice selling. She will buy sacks of rice at wholesale price, and then she’ll retail it per kilo. It will add some profit for her. Moreover, mineral water distribution is in demand nowadays. Susan thinks that it is a good enterprise to venture into. 

Susan is in need of PHP 30,000 additional capital to buy sacks of rice and containers of mineral water. Someday she hopes to put up several branches of her store that will surely give her family the comfortable life that God wants for His children. Susan meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and containers of mineral water as additional items for sale in her variety store.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles and other goods.

Gina has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and married with two children.

Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Wilma has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Wilma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 45 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are attending school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Daylinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Daylinda has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 26 years old, married with one child.

Jovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

Jovelyn has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Jovelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and other personal care products.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and has five children. Vilma is married and has two children who are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 61 years old, widowed with seven children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other things.

Imelda has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Imelda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee and drinks.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 63 years old and married with one child. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine works hard to support her family. Elaine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elaine has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business.

Lorena has been in this business for 6 years. Lorena earns additional income from buying and selling used clothing.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle unit for her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old and has three children. Jenelyn is married and has one child still in school.

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 5 years now, she also earns additional income from poultry and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marga Indah Ternak Group

texts.en:
The Marga Indah Ternak group have received their seventh loan from MUK and can receive their funds. Ni Komang, head of the group, manages her loans wisely. Any repayment of the loan is done on time under the supervision of the head of the group. 

Ni Komang is head of the group. She has many sows and she uses her portion of loans to purchase super quality feed only. She must protect the health of her sows. Ni Komang sold her piglets at a satisfactory price after keeping them for 2 months. Ni Komang is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she thanks lenders for their support. Ni Komang spends 200,000 IDR per month on electricity and water.

The Marga Indah Ternak group received their new loan. The group expected to get an increased amount of money for the loan, but after the evaluation from MUK's staff, each member received the same amount as before. One member has resigned because she had to move to the city for a new job there.

Ni Luh is a piglet-seller in her village. One sow can give birth to 8 to 12 piglets. She hopes the sows will birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She sells the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque. She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital (buy cows).

In the meeting, one of the members can’t attend because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase superior quality feed.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 60 years old, married with six children. 

Irenia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Irenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irenia has been farming rice for ten years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Irenia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Kledio est une ménagère âgée de 32 ans qui réside au Mali. Portant une calebasse d’oignon en main, elle vit avec son mari cultivateur de son état et ses quatre enfants comprise entre 1 à 13 ans dont un écolier. Dans l’avenir elle envisage d’aider sa famille à se procurer des matériels nécessaires pour l’agriculture. Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour financer ses besoins en semence et en engrais pour le maraichage qu’elle pratique depuis près de huit ans. Ses prêts sont utilisés pour acheter des semences (oignons, tomates).Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de proximité et vend ses productions dans ses mêmes marchés.
texts.en:
Kledio is a housewife, aged 32, and lives in Mali. She is the one holding the basket of onions in her hand [in the photo]. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their four children, who are between one and 13 years old. One of the children goes to school.
