In the future, she hopes to help her family procure the needed materials to farm. She joined RMCR to finance her need for seeds and fertilizer for the market gardening that she has done for almost eight years.

Her loans are used to buy seeds (onions, tomatoes). She procures her materials from the local markets and makes her sales in the same markets.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her field

loans.name: Obenikina Group

texts.fr:
Kassim est un cultivateur âgé de 38 ans qui réside au mali.
Tenant la corde du bœuf en main au bout sur la photo, il vit avec sa femme ménagère  et ses trois enfants âgés de 1 à 12 ans dont un scolarisé. Dans l’avenir, il compte creuser des puits à grande diamètres pour subvenir au besoin de son hameau en eau potable. Il fait recourt au RMCR  pour financer son activité de l’embouche qu’il pratique depuis cinq ans. Il utilise son prêt pour acheter  ses produits (bœufs affaiblis). Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses produits dans ses mêmes marchés. Il se réjouit de cette activité pour le bénéfice qu’il réalise par cycle.
texts.en:
Kassim is a 38-year-old farmer who lives in Mali. He is the one holding the cow's leash in the photo. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and their three children, aged from one to 12 years old. One of the children goes to school.

In the future, he hopes to dig large wells to support his area's need for drinkable water.

Kassim joined RMCR to finance his livestock farming, which he has done for five years. He will use this loan to buy weak cows. He procures the livestock in the surrounding markets and resells them in the same markets.

He welcomes this work, because of the earnings he receives each time.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lilibeth has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Grace Ann

texts.en:
Grace Ann is 37 years old and married. With one child in school, Grace Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Grace Ann has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Grace Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 44 years old and married with five children. With five children currently in school, Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Luz has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, cereals, juice, detergent soap, sanitary pads, etc. 

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cristy Olivia

texts.en:
Pottery is like shaping a person’s life. One has to undergo breaking, forming again, shaping, spinning, heating and removing of unnecessary fluids that lead to permanent changes like hardening and strengthening of a beautiful outcome, a pot or a vessel. A person’s experiences and trials will also result in his/her intensified vigor if handled properly. After all those hardships, a person can be a beautiful channel of blessings to others. 

It is interesting that Cristy chose to venture into a pottery business. She has deeply appreciated the processes that happened before she can touch these products. She can compare it to her changed life. Now, she has the capacity to help others by employing them in her pottery shop located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She has three workers who create earthenware products. There are various shapes of pots, jars, vases, and vessels which are attractive to both local and visiting buyers. However, the income from this business is not always promising. Cristy knows it; that is why she also invested in a tricycle. 

Cristy is single but she has dependents who are studying in college. Single persons in the Philippines are expected to help their parents, siblings, or siblings’ children. As a good daughter, Cristy assumes responsibilities for her family. 

Now that she finds difficulty in reserving raw materials for pottery, she desires to have a loan assistance of PHP 51,000 to buy a volume of raw materials. She will also use part of the loan to pay her workers. Payment for volume pottery orders from her shop comes late at times, and she needs to adjust so her workers’ salary won’t be affected.

Cristy is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Letecia is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Letecia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel has a live-in partner and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Isabel is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Isabel has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Ma. Isabel requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beauty products for her business.

Ma. Isabel has been in this business for 18 years. Ma. Isabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josefa is 59 years old now.

Josefa has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Josefa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, blouses, etc.

Josefa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Josefa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Jiezel

texts.en:
Jiezel is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Jiezel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jiezel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jiezel has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jiezel would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old and has five children. Naomi is married and has three children who are in school.

Naomi is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Naomi requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Naomi has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Naomi would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and has six children. Judith is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been in this business for 19 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 76 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of of household goods to sell.

Luz has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2011 rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 40 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 2 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce de mangues et la transformation de l'arachide en huile.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 100 kg d'arachide pour une valeur de 50000f et un panier de mangue à 6000f.*

Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra de consolider son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011 and is comprised of members who live in the same village and work in retail trade and farming. 

Fatou, who is found on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the featured borrower of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two boys. She works selling mangos and making groundnuts into oil.

With this loan, she plans to buy 100 kilograms of groundnuts for 50,000 francs and a tray of mangos for 6,000 francs. 

Earnings will allow her to consolidate her business and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy mangos, and groundnuts to make into oil

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marivic is 33 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Marivic has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional tools and materials for her business.

Marivic has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and materials for her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maribel is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a general store business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food and other personal care products to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 23 years old and married with one child.

She runs an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lovelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lovelyn has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 44 years old and married with four children.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care items and other groceries.

Angeles has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling peanut butter.

Angeles aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, personal product care items and other groceries.

loans.name: Narcesa

texts.en:
Narcesa is 52 years old and married with seven children. With two children still in school, Narcesa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Narcesa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, noodles, fabric conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Narcesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 29 ans. Mère de cinq enfants, Abla habite à Agoè pour exercer ses activités. Abla est très dynamique et pour aider sa famille, elle vend des sacs de friperies exposés son quartier afin de trouver son bénéfice. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander de nouveaux sacs, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour financer son achat et trouver assez de profits et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants et permettre leur éducation.
texts.en:
Abla is a married, 29-year-old woman. A mother of five children, she lives in Agoe and earns a living. Abla is very dynamic and to help her family she sells used bags, which she displays in her area.

She procures the bags twice a month from the market. 

So that she can order new bags, she is seeking this loan to finance the purchase and to facilitate enough profits that she will be able to cover her children's needs and to ensure their education.

loans.use: to buy 16 used bags

loans.name: Lorela

texts.en:
A survivor is always a survivor!

This is Lorela, a 45-year-old “sari-sari” (variety) store owner who is married to Arnold, a 43-year-old security guard. They reside in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with their children. They survived the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Lorela’s variety store business was affected by the typhoon but with the help of her family, they were able to rebuild it.

Lorela’s income from her store varies over time as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Consumers are inclined to buy from a store that has wide variety of items and merchandise. Lorela hopes to expand her business by adding to her selection of supplies in order to meet the demands of consumers. With that method, she will be able to boost her income so that she can have some additional to use in their house renovation. She humbly seeks your help through a PHP 25,000 loan. Praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to a survivor like her, and eventually make her family enjoy the comfortable life that God wants all His children to have. 

Lorela meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her variety store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and has two children. Rosalie is married and has one child still in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalie has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. Levy is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bread, chips, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Levy has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Levy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chips, soft drinks, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married with nine children. With three children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care items, home product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care, home product care items, and other groceries.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 59 years old and is a widow with four children. Monina works very hard to provide for them.

Monina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Monina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Monina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zulma Emerita

texts.es:
Zulma, ha experimentado un cambio agradable en su vida familiar puesto que las necesidades son menos, dice que los nuevos ingresos le permiten cumplir con todos sus compromisos, además su negocio se mantiene con vida y cuenta con más clientes, todo esto es posible por la buena administración del crédito anterior.
Está optando por un nuevo crédito para surtir el inventario de su negocio, comprará huevos, carnes, embutidos, aceite, granos básicos, sal, bebidas, etc.,  para que la tienda siga siendo competitiva, espera que la afluencia de clientes se mantenga.
texts.en:
Zulma has experienced an agreeable change in her family life as their needs are now fewer.  She says that the new income allows her to meet all her commitments and also maintains her business livelihood and she has more clients.

All of this has been possible due to good management of previous loans.  She is choosing to take out a new loan to increase the inventory of her business and will buy eggs, meats, deli meats, oil, basic grains, salt, drinks etc. so that the shop continues being competitive.  She hopes to maintain her clientele.

loans.use: to buy eggs, meats, deli meats, oil, basic grains, salt, drinks etc. so that her shop continues being competitive

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and married with five children. With five children still in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and other things.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread.

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn is grateful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive harvest on her banana farm.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and for her children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Lewelyn dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to have happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her banana farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Irene is 40 years old now.

Irene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other supplies.

Irene has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old and married.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Norma has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from guitar making.

Norma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and a widow with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jonna

texts.en:
Jonna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jonna is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jonna has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Jonna requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jonna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jonna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette works hard to support her family. Lynette is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc.

Lynette has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Lynette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soap.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Zenaida has a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline to sell in her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell in her business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a married woman with one child in school. Emerita is 50 years old now.

Emerita has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Emerita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Emerita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos, la casa que habitan es alquilada, su esposo es empleado como guardia de seguridad y su hijo actualmente se encuentra desempleado, su otro hijo es independiente y vive en otro lugar, ella se dedica a vender ropa desde hace 20 años, ofrecía poca mercadería, con la administración adecuada de las ganancias y el apoyo de créditos ha ampliado su negocio.
Su deseo de superación es muy grande por tal razón solicita un crédito en Padecomsm, lo utilizara para comprar básicamente camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, entre otras prendas de vestir, pretende adquirir la mercadería a precios más bajos para que así sus ganancias puedan ser mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son tener mejores ingresos con los que cancelara la deuda y podrá aportar para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila is married with two children and lives with her husband and one of their children.  The house they live in is rented.  Her husband is employed as a security guard and her son is currently unemployed, while her other son is independent and lives in another place.  

She sells clothes and has done so for 20 years.  She used to offer a small range of products, but with adequate management of the profits and with the help of loans she has grown her business.  

Her desire to improve her life is strong and for that reason she has requested a loan from Padescomsm, which she will use to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, pants and other clothing items.  She hopes to buy the clothes an lower prices so that her profits are higher.  Her aspirations are to have better income which which she will repay the loan, and to be able to contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, pants and other items of clothing

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 50 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lucrecia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Lucrecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lucrecia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Lucrecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Evelyn, 32, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jhiez, a kitchen technician and has one child who is still in the Elementary Level. The couple work hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send their child to school.

Evelyn operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such canned goods, instant noodles, soft drinks, toiletries, etc. which she sells at her store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are a source for them to meet their daily expense and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Evelyn dreams of expanding her store to give her child a college education to allow her better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family. Ninfa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for 7 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy empty gas cylinders and refill them for resale

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bienvenida is 57 years old now.

Bienvenida has a native slipper-making business in the Philippines. Bienvenida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and other needed supplies.

Bienvenida has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Bienvenida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and other needed supplies.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future Annabelle would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glory Dewata Group

texts.en:
Glory Dewata group repaid their loan on time. Ni Wayan, head of the group, tells of her success in raising pigs. From the first loan she got from MUK, Ni Wayan has one sow. But now she has 2 sows and each sow gave birth to 12 piglets. Ni Wayan sold the piglets after keeping them for 2 months. All profits she saved and they will be used for working capital so that she can be independent in terms of capital. 

Her garden also produced a maximal result. She planted cabbage, carrots, corn and potatoes. Ni Wayan is very grateful for the help she has received so far. Ni Wayan still hopes for assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital or training, so that she and all members of the group can be successful farmers and breeders.

After obtaining satisfactory results in previous loan period, the Glory Dewata group continue borrowing. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed and repair cages.

Ni Wayan will use the loan to buy feed, repair cages and pay maintenance costs for her garden. She’s using her own money to buy seed. Ni Wayan has 6 piglets for fattening and they are scheduled to be sold in 5 months. Ni Wayan and her husband also plan to raise cattle. With the profits she earned  last period, she bought a calf. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better and if all goes well, she will increase the number of cows.

2 members are not pictured because they had to attend a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to buy feed, repair cages and pay maintenance costs for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new tires, gears and a motorcycle chain.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sabina is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sabina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Sabina requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sabina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Sabina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rechie

texts.en:
Rechie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rechie is 53 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Rechie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rechie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Rechie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rechie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, fish, spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 63 years old, married with 13 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Concepcion has a general store business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, school supplies and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teresita has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to pack and sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to pack and sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive is 35 years old, married, and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Genevive requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall. Genevive is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from photocopying. 

Remedios aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now. Rosemarie works hard to support her family. 

Rosemarie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sonia Leticia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 8 meses y 5 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Sonia con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, ella tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor.
Sonia desde hace algún tiempo se ha puesto a ver las necesidades de su familia y se ha dado cuenta que una de las necesidades primordiales de su familia es adquirir un lote de terreno para poder cultivar, pero una de las dificultades que Sonia tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la compra por tal razón solicita un préstamo.
Sonia tiene el anhelo de mejorar su vivienda para darle a sus hijos una mejor vida y también que ellos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 28-year-old woman, married, and has a lovely family of four children between the ages of 8 months and 5 years. This humble family lives in a community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Sonia, with the desire to get income and support her husband with the household expenses, works raising and selling chickens. She has been doing this work for four years.

Sonia, for some time, has been looking at her family's needs and has realized that one of her family's basic needs is to get a plot of land to be able to cultivate. But one of the difficulties Sonia has is that she doesn't have enough money to be able to make the purchase, so she asks for a loan. 

Sonia has the desire to improve her house to give her children a better life and also that they become great professionals.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Tania José

texts.es: Tania es una carismática joven de 21 años de edad, residente en el municipio de Baranoa ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico en donde funciona su restaurante y ofrece todos los días servicio de desayunos y almuerzos.  Su idea de negocio nació en el año 2014 y su dedicación y esfuerzo se ha hecho notar, aunque su principal desafío ha sido posicionarse en el sector, hoy en día  cuenta con una buena base de clientes que llegan a su restaurante a degustar de sus deliciosos platillos a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres para la elaboración de sus comidas; arroz, aceite, carnes y demás. Ella es madre de una niña de cuatro años de edad a quien ofrece bienestar fruto de su trabajo.  Su meta familiar es adquirir una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Tania is a charismatic young woman, 21 years old, who lives in the municipality of Baranoa, located in the Atlantic department where she runs her restaurant and offers breakfasts and lunches every day. Her business idea was born in the year 2014 and her dedication and efforts have made it stand out despite her main challenge of positioning herself in the sector. Now she has a good customer base which comes to her restaurant to enjoy her delicious dishes from 8 am to 4 pm. Currently, she is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in groceries to make her dishes: rice, oil, meat, and more. She is the mother for a four-year-old girl to whom she offers well-being, the fruit of her labors.  Her family goal is to get a house to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in groceries to make her dishes: rice, oil, meat and more.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente actualmente está trabajando y estudiando para poder solventar sus estudios y sus otros gastos universitarios. Está estudiando para poder ser alguien en la vida y por medio de sus conocimientos poder abrirse camino.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, con la cual también quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Vicente currently is going to school and working to be able to pay for his education and other university expenses. He is studying to be able to be someone in live and through his knowledge be able to pave his own way.

He is studying for a degree in accounting, with which he also wants to be able to help his family and his loved ones.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the costs for his program and, with that, be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es de una humilde familia, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas y con su carrera quiere convertirse en un gran profesional.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir sus metas y anhelos, y con ello ser alguien importante en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Antonio is from the city of Caaguazú, is from a humble family and is studying business administration and with his degree, he wants to become a good professional.

He is putting forth his best effort to be able to realize his dreams and desires and, with this, be someone important in life.

He asks for this loan to pay the tuition for his program and, so, be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Ma. Heidi was encouraged that she was previously granted a 12,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan which she used for the maintenance of her apartment that she rents out to boarders. Through her earnings she is able to provide for her family's personal and everyday household needs.

She would now like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP which she will use for the materials, paint and cost of labour needed for the continuous maintenance and renovation of her place.

She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her. Her rental income is a big help to cover her family's daily sustenance and to support her child's schooling.

Ma. Heidi dreams of building another apartment in her neighbouring town to improve her income. She prays that God will bless their lives abundantly. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a cultivar maíz y a comercializar ganado para tener los recursos económicos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, tiene 10 años de tener su negocio propio, lo trabaja solo, por el momento no tiene dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz, espera tener los materiales básicos para que sus cultivos den una cosecha abundante, y así abastecer tanto a su familia como a sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar trabajando para tener mejores circunstancias económicas y ganar popularidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and children. He works growing corn and selling livestock to have the economic resources that he needs to cover the household expenses. He has had his own business for 10 years, he works alone, and at the moment he doesn't have any problems doing his work.

He will invest in agricultural supplies to plant corn. He hopes to have the basic materials so that his crops give an abundant harvest, and in this way supply his family as well as his customers.

His aspirations are to continue working to have better economic circumstances and gain popularity on the community.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a 22-year-old woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Kimberly has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Kimberly requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to pack and sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to pack and sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 57 years old and married with six children.

Sabina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Sabina has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from videoke machine rental and handicrafts.

She has successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Sabina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rita is 46 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rita has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines. Rita requested a 5000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more spices and other items to pack and sell.

Rita has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices and other items to pack and sell.

loans.name: Cesar Wilian

texts.es:
Cesar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad; se dedica a vender agua purificada desde hace 6 años, él compra de forma directa el producto a la empresa para luego salir a comercializarlo en su vehículo, el negocio lo aprendió con la ayuda de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, por el momento no tiene dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar 2 llantas para su vehículo, le permitirá tener  su equipo de  trabajo en buenas condiciones para salir a vender agua, no representa dificultades en la inversión.
Los proyectos que tiene Cesar son ampliar su negocio, mejorar la rentabilidad y lograr que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cesar lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 12. He has worked selling purified water for the past 6 years. He purchases the product directly from the company and then goes out to sell it from his vehicle. He learned the business with the help of his family. His work schedule is from five in the morning until five in the afternoon. At the moment, he doesn't have any difficulties in doing his work.

He is asking for a loan to purchase 2 tires for his vehicle. This will allow him to have his work equipment in good condition to go out and sell water. There aren't any difficulties in the investment.

Cesar's plans are to expand his business, improve the profitability and manage to have his children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 2 tires for his vehicle; it will allow him to have his working equipment in good conditions to go out and sell water.

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es: Amparo es una emprendedora mujer que trabajó durante varios años como vendedora en almacenes que comercializaban diferentes tipos de productos, gracias a estas experiencias laborales tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio desde la comodidad de su hogar; compro una vitrina exhibidora de productos belleza, cosméticos, bisutería, papelería, juguetería y accesorios para celulares.  Este negocio tiene tres años de funcionamiento en un barrio del municipio de Baranoa, todos los días a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares pueden realizar sus compras de contado, sin embargo ella también les ofrece facilidad de pago. Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes del centro de la ciudad a distribuidores y mayoristas, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la copra de prendas para vestir; pantalones y camisas. Amparo tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de dos hijas a quienes desea continuarles brindando bienestar, su meta a largo plazo es comprar su vivienda y tener un almacén.
texts.en: Amparo is an enterprising woman who worked for some years as a saleswoman in stores which sold different types of products. Thanks to these work experiences, she decided to begin her own business from the comfort of her home. She purchased a display case of beauty products, cosmetics, costume jewelry, paper goods, toys and cell phone accessories. This business has been open for three years in a neighborhood in the municipality of Baranoa. Every day from 9 am to 7 pm her customers, who are in the great majority her neighbors, friends and family members, can make their purchases in cash. However, she also offers payment terms. She makes her purchases in cash in the stores in the city center from distributors and wholesalers. Currently, she is asking for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in purchasing clothing - pants and shirts. Amparo is 35 years old and is the mother of two daughters to whom she wants to continue providing their well-being. Her long-term goal is to purchase her home and have a shop.

loans.use: to invest in clothing -- pants and shirts.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, por los buenos resultados que tiene de los créditos se ha decidido a solicitar más capital para poder comprar abono, insecticidas y plaguicidas tendrá a su disposición los materiales necesarios para sembrar maíz y frijol, espera que las cosechas sean las planeadas para tener alimento para su familia y para abastecer a sus clientes.
Al utilizar el crédito anterior en su negocio ha mejorado sus cultivos, sus ingresos han cambiado y las condiciones familiares son más confortables.
texts.en:
Miguel, for the good results that he has had from the loans, has decided to ask for more capital to be able to purchase manure, insecticides and pesticides to have at his disposal the necessary materials to plant corn and beans. He hopes that the harvests are as he plans, to have food for his family and supply his customers.

When using the previous loan in his business, he has improved his crops, his income has changed and his family conditions are more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticides and pesticides to have at his disposal the necessary materials to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Chicas Latinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “Chicas Latinas, esta conformados por 5 jóvenes quienes han salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y su emprendimiento de cada una de ellas. Están con ADIM por 2da vez, para solicitar crédito para seguir abasteciendo sus negocios. 
Josefa es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 27 años y está casada. Desde hace 2 años tiene su mini-pulpería y vende ropa usada.  Este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de celulares. El crédito que solicito lo comprara para 1 paca mixta de ropa usada, arroz, azúcar, aceite y gaseosas. Esto le ayudara a obtener mayores ingresos y así aumentar sus ganancias. 
Las demás miembros, son Ninoska, de 22 años, se dedica al destace de cerdo y a la preparación de sopas. Meylin de 26 años tiene una pulpería en su domicilio. María Teresa, 31 años vende ropa usada y una fritangeria. Gloria, 25 años, tiene una mini-pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Chicas Latinas" group is made up of 5 young women who each have gotten ahead thanks to their efforts and undertakings.  They are with ADIM for a second loan cycle to request a loan in order to continue to stock their businesses.

Josefa is the group coordinator, is 27 years old and is married.  She has had her small grocery store for the past two years and also sells used clothing.  She started this business with the help of her husband who works selling cell phones.

With the loan she will buy one pack of mixed used clothing, rice, sugar, oil, and soda.  This will help her to increase her revenue and so increase her income.  

The other members are: Ninoska, 22 years old, who works as a pork butcher and also makes soups; Meylin, 26 years old, who has a small grocery store in her home; María Teresa, 31 years old, sells used clothing and has a food stall where she sells fried foods; and Gloria, 25 years old, who has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 27 years, a single man and he supports one child.He has been selling soft drinks such as sodas in the market for the last one year and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more crates of soda for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector.His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of sodas for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 64 years old and has four children who are in school.

Estrella has a general store business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, canned good, noodles and other groceries.

Estrella has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, canned good, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Maricel has been in this business for 11 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To open her own small shop, so as to upgrade from street selling into a more professional sales environment

loans.name: Roshelle

texts.en:
Roshelle is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roshelle is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Roshelle has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Roshelle requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices like garlic, etc, to pack and sell.

Roshelle has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Roshelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices like garlic, etc, to pack and sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old. He is one of two children in his family. He helps his parents support their family financially. Henry works full time in the field Information Technology. He has decided to open his own Zoona business in a quest to increase his income. 

Henry is an aspiring entrepreneur and is very driven by the opportunities afforded to him through his Zoona business, he particularly enjoys servicing people in his community from a variety of backgrounds. Henry’s Zoona business brings financial services to people in his community who previously had to travel longer distances in order to send or receive money. One of the challenges Henry faces is that he currently does not own the trading booth that he is using to serve customers.

Henry is requesting a loan in order to purchase a trading kiosk, owning his own Kiosk will help Henry save on operational costs. Henry's dream is to grow his business so that it can provide him with increased income to support himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase a trading kiosk, to facilitate local money transfers and support his family

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 33 años, es una mujer laboriosa, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 15 años. Ella desde hace 9 años se dedica a la ventas de CD y accesorios de celulares. Este negocio lo inicio con un préstamo que le hizo su mama. Actualmente recibe ayuda de sus hermanos quienes laboran en el negocio. Ahora ella esta con solicitando a ADIM por décima vez un crédito para poder surtir su negocio con más productos variados y comprara cargadores y protectores para celulares. con las ganancias obtenidas seguirá ampliando el negocio y podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Sonia, 33 years old, is a hardworking woman. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 15. For the past 9 years, she has been selling CDs and cell phone accessories. She started this business with a loan that her mother gave her. Currently, she is receiving support from her siblings who work in the business. 

She is now requesting her 10th loan from ADIM, to be able to stock her business with more varied products and purchase cell phone chargers and protectors. With the profit she receives, she will continue expanding the business and be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase cell phone chargers and protectors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables, meat and stall stocks like rice, cooking oil, seasoning, shampoo, soap, detergent, etc

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of banana to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Erlinda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Violeta is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Violeta has a personal product retail business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of personal care products to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Santos Cayetano

texts.es:
Santos, utilizo el crédito anterior para realizar sus trabajos agrícolas en el tiempo justo y también para mejorar la ganadería, su situación económica ha mejorado lo que le permite salir adelante con su familia.
Se acerca la nueva temporada de siembra por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito que le servirá básicamente para comprar abono, insecticidas y semilla, así mismo pagar mozos para continuar cultivando granos básicos, espera que haga un buen invierno para que su cosecha sea abundante.
texts.en:
Santos used the previous loan to carry out his farming work at the right time and also to improve the cattle. His economic situation has improved, allowing him to move forward with his family.

The new planting season is coming, so he is requesting a new loan that will serve him basically to buy manure, insecticides, and seeds, likewise to pay workers to continue growing staple grains. He expects a good winter to come so that his harvest is abundant.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, and seeds and to pay workers to continue growing staple grains and feeding cattle.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecelia is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cecelia has a processed food business in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her lubid (sweet fried bread) making business.

Cecelia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her lubid (sweet fried bread) making business

loans.name: Venciana

texts.en:
Venciana is 55 years old and married with three children.  

Venciana is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Venciana requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Venciana has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Venciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto tiene 52 años de edad es casado vive en chimbo en el barrio Tamban de la provincia de Bolivar, el es servidor público hace algunos años, solicita el crédito para la compra de un Electrodoméstico como es una refrigeradora ya que la que tenia se le daño por que era ya muy antigua, va a comprar en guaranda en el almacen La Ganga, su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida, los desafios a los que se enfrenta son las enfrermedades, en su tiempo libre le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Modesto is 52 years old, is married, and lives in Chimbo in the town of Tamban in the Bolivar province.  He has worked in public service for some years, and is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator since the one he has spoils food because it is very old.  He is going to make the purchase in Guaranda in the town of La Ganga.

His dream is to improve his quality of life.  The challenges he faces are illnesses and in his free time he likes to walk.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Jinelyn

texts.en:
Jinelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail rice business in the Philippines.

Jinelyn has been in this business for 5 years now. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. Nelly is married and has a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Monina has been in this business for 10 years. Monina earns more income from pig fattening.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Angelu is 16 years old and the eldest of four children in his family. His mother, Jessica, has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for four years and supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Angelu is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology and is currently in the first year of this four-year program.

Jessica is borrowing 10,000 to pay for tuition fees for her son Angelu for the 2015-2016 school year.

When he graduates, Angelu plans to help his parents and help his brother and sisters receive their educations.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is 49 years old and married with eight children. With two children currently in school, Naida works very hard to provide for the family.

Naida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, biscuits, and diapers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Naida has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

In the future, Naida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 20 years now.

Nenita has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines. Wilma has been in this business for 5 years now.

Wilma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials, like fabric, for her business.

Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like fabric, for her rug-making business

loans.name: Gloria Cielo

texts.en:
Gloria Cielo is 30 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from gasoline retailing.

Gloria Cielo has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Gloria Cielo aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. Isabel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Isabel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Isabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 49 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ethel has a sewing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Ethel has requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business.

Ethel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and selling seashells. 

Elsie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business. Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 15 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y está acompañada y se dedica a la agricultura y al cuido de las vacas que tiene, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad.  

María, se dedica a trabajar la agricultura en las parcelas que tiene, este trabajo lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a ordeñar sus vacas y a elaborar cuajada para venderla.

María, necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca, para produce bastante leche para incrementar su producción de leche y poder elaborar otro tipo de lácteos como crema y quesillo.  

María, sueña con comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and has a partner and a son who is 14. She studied until the 6th grade and makes a living farming and looking after her cows. She learned these skills from her parents. 

Maria makes a living farming on her fields. She carries out this work in the mornings with her husband and in the afternoons she milks her cows and prepares cottage cheese to sell. 

Maria needs the loan to buy a cow to increase her milk production so she can make other types of dairy such as cream and fresh cheese. 

Maria's dream is to buy some land for her animals to graze on.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Perseverante Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Perseverante¨, está constituido por dos mujeres y dos varones dueños de sus propios negocios y con ganas de seguir adelante y seguir emprendiendo en sus vidas.
Don Pedro, de 36 años es el coordinador, él está solicitando un crédito para mejorar el servicio de transporte que ofrece a su comunidad. Este negocio lo empezó hace 2 años y con el crédito para compra de llantas nuevas. Así asegura que los usuarios que usen sus servicios se trasladen en forma segura y  brindara un excelente servicio. Los otros miembros, son Ana de 25 años, y vende ropa nueva. Rosa de 56 años prepara y vende tamales de forma ambulante en su comunidad. Y Gustavo de 45 años quien compra y vende cosechas.
texts.en:
The group "Perseverante" is made up of two women and two men who run their own business. They are motivated to get ahead and keep being entrepreneurial in their lives. 

Pedro, 36, is the coordinator and he is requesting a loan to improve the motorcycle taxi service which he offers in his local area. He started this business 2 years ago. He will use the loan to buy new wheels to make sure that the travellers who use his service are transported safely and are offered an excellent service. 

The other members of the group are 25-year-old Ana who sells clothes, 56-year-old Rosa who prepares and sells tamales on the streets in the local area, and 45-year-old Gustavo who buys and sells crops.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 28 años de edad, vive en armonia con su conyuge y sus dos menores hijos que estudian en colegios de la zona, vive en casa propia de material rústico cuenta con servicios de agua, ubicada en la zona rural del caserio Nueva Alianza, distrito de Pimpingos ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajmarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza cliente es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has de cafe. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantacion esta en segundo año de producción, actividad la realiza hace 5 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, con buenas referencias. Tambien se dedica a la cria y venta de ganado vacuno, peonaje, adiconalmente cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, viticas, menestras y otros).

El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 has De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel is 28 years old and lives in harmony with his spouse and his two children, who are minors and study at schools in the area. He lives in his own house, of rustic materials and with a water supply, located in the rural area of the village Nueva Alianza, in the Pimpingos district, province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region located in the northern mountains of Peru.

The client's activity is growing coffee. He currently has one hectare of coffee, of the Catimor variety, which is resistent to pests and diseases. This plantation is in the second year of production but Fidel has been growing coffee for five years. He has experience in the coffee-growing business and good references. He also makes a living breeding and selling cattle, working as a farm labourer, breeding small animals, such as hens, guinea pigs, pigs and others, and growing staple food crops, such as yucca, plantain, chia seeds, lentils and others.

The loan will be used to maintain and cultivate his one hectare of coffee, assuring a good output for the 2015 season, which will be reflected in higher sales. As a result, Fidel will increase his income and will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate one hectare of coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize for milling so as to meet client demands for maize flour.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 46-year-old, married mother of seven children, one of whom is still in school. 

Susan is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain it. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mbaya

texts.en:
Mbaya from Zambia feels very blessed for the tremendous support from Kiva lenders who have helped her develop and run a Mobile money transfer business to earn income for her and her family. She is 32 years old and spend her time serving customers who need access to financial services in Choma, a town located in the southern province of Zambia.

Mbaya got her first Kiva loan to purchase two trading booths so that she could expand her business.  She managed to open the outlets and was able to access her second loan which she used to increase the float in her business. She now runs three successful mobile money transfer shops. 

Mbaya is requesting a subsequent loan in order to open three more mobile money transfer outlets in the southern province. Once she opens the additional locations, Mbaya will be able to employ three more people to work at the kiosks. Mbaya currently employs three people. She is very happy with the growth experienced in her business and would like to keep opening up more outlets so that she can serve more people in rural in Zambia. 

Mbaya's dream is to become a successful business woman and own 20 Mobile money tranfer outlets throughout the Southern province of Zambia. She explains that a lot of her family members are unemployed and she will be able to empower them by helping them with jobs.

loans.use: To purchase three trading kiosks so that she can open two more Mobile money transfer outlets and make jobs for people

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 51 years old and married. She has eight children, two of whom are still in school.

Lilibeth is in the agriculture business in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and she has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.
