Lilibeth has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 41 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 20, all of whom go to school. 

Fortunee is a farmer, and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the requested loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ma. Anecita

texts.en:
Ma. Anecita is married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Ma. Anecita is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Anecita requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Ma. Anecita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ma. Anecita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Cansenila

texts.en:
Cansenila is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cansenila is 59 years old now.

Cansenila has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Cansenila requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Cansenila has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Cansenila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to sell

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
Tsotsoo is a 58-year-old single mother who live alone in Teshie-Accra. She has owned grocery and soft drink business for the last sixteen years. She purchases grocery from market and soft drinks from the distributors at a low price and sells them on at a profitable price at her home in a store.

She has built up very close relationships with the her customers in the society. She wants to buy variety of soft drinks and grocery to sell. But she does not have the amount of money to do so due to her household expenses. Therefore, Tsotsoo requested a loan so that she can buy more soft drinks and grocery which she will sell to her customers. Tsotsoo, together with her friends would want to better the business and make more profit. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner ID-Ghana, Teshie branch.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and grocery which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery enterprise.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is 46 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 30 years.

Nighat's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Nighat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.
On this financial assistance Nighat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 65, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has six children in total. To make a living, she has been involved in the farming business since 1970, grows rice, and sells her agricultural produce to local dealers and customers in the market. She is able to generate a net profit of USD 2.50 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her farming, she has requested to borrow some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be focused and goal oriented. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy another motorcyle. This will enable him increase his income and create employment.. He hopes that in the future, he will build rental houses. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle to increase his business

loans.name: Josenia

texts.en:
Josenia is a woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josenia is 30 years old and has five children who are in school.

Josenia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Josenia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and from farming sugarcane. Edna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 68 years old and widowed with seven children.

Lydia is in the agriculture business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for twelve years now, and she has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. Lydia has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell, such as shirts, pants, skirts, socks and underwear for both genders.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 38 years old and married with five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Marina is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been involved in pig fattening for 3 years now. Marina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. 

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a woman of 59 years old, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Aurelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aurelia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Aurelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a rural housewife of 36.  She lives with her husband and one daughter in a small village of Alipurduar. Her daughter is in grade 8 in a local village school. 

Namita's husband has been running a small grocery shop with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, salt, oil, lentils, eggs, etc. for many years. Namita is a homemaker and does some sewing work in her home.  Namita also helps her husband in running the store. He started the business with a small investment of his own. Now they want to expand their store by adding some more often-requested items for sale to attract more customers. 

That is why Namita has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items for their grocery store. She hopes that this investment will give them more income with enough for savings and she will be able to provide sufficient financial sustenance to her family and give a better education to her daughter.

Namita wants to buy a small piece of land in the future with the profit generated from this business.

She is very grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 49 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters, her children are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 6 years. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Shagufta is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Thelma is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Thelma has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like bamboo, nipa leaves, etc. for her business and earns additional income from raiising livestock and selling firewood.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Thelma has been in this business for 4 years. Thelma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like bamboo, nipa leaves, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Vina is a married woman and 55 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Vina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Vina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Cherryl Marie

texts.en:
Cherryl Marie is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school.

Cherryl Marie has a butcher shop in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to butcher and sell from her stall.

In the future, Cherryl Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to butcher and sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 55 years old and married with three children.

Luz is in the agriculture business. She has been involved in pig fattening for 5 years now. Luz has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 35-year-old woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marina has had a food vending business in the Philippines for four years. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and raw produce for her business.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw produce for her business

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Connie has owned a dried fish vending business in the Philippines for three years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 53 years old and both of her children are being sent to school.

Rosemarie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

Rosemarie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 45 años que se encuentra muy satisfecho por el apoyo que se le brindo con el crédito pues gracias a ello pudo comprar sus insumos agrícolas y pudo cultivar en esa temporada, afortunadamente obtuvo muy buena cosecha no así sus ingresos mejoraron, Eduardo confía mucho en ADICLA por ser una institución  que por años le ha ofrecido todo su apoyo; el nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de papa y fertilizantes para su cultivo de esta temporada.
Eduardo tiene el anhelo de comprar un terreno para que sus hijos tengan donde poder cultivar o construir.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 45 years old and he is very satisfied with the support he was offered with his previous loan. Thanks to the loan, he was able to buy his farming supplies and grow crops this season. Thankfully, he had a really good harvest and his earnings improved. 

Eduardo really trusts ADICLA for being an institution that has, for many years, offered him all their support. He is again requesting a loan so he can buy potato seeds and fertilizers for his crops this year. 

Eduardo longs to buy land so that his children can have somewhere to grow crops or build a house.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rita is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. business.

Rita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Rita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her son's electrical goods and repair shop.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Mawussi est un homme célibataire âgé de 38 ans. Mawussi vit à Tokoin avec un enfant à sa charge. Pour trouver son revenu, Mawussi vend des articles de librairies dans son quartier afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Mawussi s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au marché. Mawussi demande ce financement pour commander des cartons de papiers rames pour faire plus de bénéfice afin d’être efficacement utile dans l’épanouissement de son enfant.
texts.en: Mawussi is 38 years old and has no partner. He lives in Tokoin with one child living in his care. Mawussi earns a living through selling library items in his local area in order to meet his daily needs. He gets his supplies eight times per month from market. Mawussi is requesting this loan to order boxes of paper so he can earn a greater profit. By doing this, he will be able to help his child succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase 12 boxes of paper

loans.name: Wiwi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Wiwi, one of Ruma’s clients. Wiwi lives in West Bogor, a village area located in West Java about 1 hour and thirty minutes' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, they have one cute child. 

Wiwi sells mobile airtime credits in her community. She has been a member of Ruma for almost a year now. She knew Ruma through a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to try to become an entrepreneur.

As the business grows, Wiwi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Your loan will be very useful to help Wiwi improve her business, which in turn benefits members of her community who need access to such services. In the near future, Wiwi hopes to work with Ruma on its latest product: Mapan, an e-commerce business for low-income communities. Later on, her community will have access to better products at lower prices. 

Wiwi is shown in the photo above. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping village community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 38 años de edad, solo estudio sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es albañil, tienen tres hijas, dos están en el la escuela y la otra ya se acompaño.

Teresa, se dedica a vender lociones, desde hace 5 años, decidió iniciar este negocio porque genera buenas ganancias,  también que no requiere mucho trabajo y en el negocio se involucran la hija mayor que tiene en su casa.

Teresa, necesita el crédito para comprar más lociones para vender y mejorar mi negocio.

Su sueño es poner una tienda de cosméticos para vender más y tener más ganancias para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 38 years old and only studied until the sixth grade. She has a partner who is a bricklayer. They have three daughters, two of whom are at school and the other has a partner. 

For the past 5 years Teresa has made a living selling lotions. She decided to start this business because she can make a good living and it doesn't require much work and also she can involve the older of her two daughters who live at home. 

Teresa needs the loan to buy more lotions to sell and improve her business.

Her dream is to open up a cosmetics shop so she can sell more products and make a better income to improve her daughters' economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more lotions to sell and improve her business.

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Kodjovi est un homme marié et père de deux enfants et âgée de 31 ans. Kodjovi habite dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Kodjovi est très entreprenant et dynamique et vend des crédits virtuels  pour les besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Kodjovi s’approvisionne quinze fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses recharges. Pour acheter des cartes de recharge, Kodjovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Kodjovi is a 31-year-old married father to two children who lives in Adidogomé. He is highly entrepreneurial and dynamic, selling top-up cards to his customers in order to earn a living. Kodjovi gets his supplies 15 times per month from market in order to have enough stock. He is requesting this loan to purchase top-up cards so he can increase his profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase top-up cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can knit more embroidery dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new Moto rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Geraldine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma is 42 years old and her two children are in school.

Emma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Emma has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Epifania is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Epifania has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines. Epifania requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Epifania has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Victorine une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses quatre enfants. Agée de 37 ans, Victorine est une commerçante de légumes et fruits au marché pour gagner son bénéfice. Victorine trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce. Victorine s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander un panier de tomates et des sacs de pommes de terre, Victorine sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir son mari à favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Victorine is a 37-year-old married mother to four children who lives in Tokoin. She is able to earn a living through selling fruits and vegetables at market. Victorine gets her supplies four times per month from the market in Lomé. She is requesting this loan to purchase one basket of tomatoes and two sacks of potatoes so she can earn enough profit to aid her husband pay for their children to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase one basket of tomatoes and two sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Mithu is a 26-year-old lady and lives in a small village of Alipurduar district with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). She studied till 6th grade and after that she dropped out due to her family's poor economic resources. But she is sending her children to local village school. Mithu’s husband is a driver by profession, and his income is inconsistent.  

Mithu runs a home-based modest grocery store to give financial support to her family. She sells the daily necessities consumed by the villagers like oil, biscuits, flour, rice, spices, sugar, salt, etc. in her shop. Gradually, her customers are increasing.

Mithu wants to expand her business by stocking up on more grocery items in her shop.This will satisfy the demand of her customers and also elevate her business income. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying groceries in bulk will be difficult for her.

Thus Mithu is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy grocery items in bulk for her shop. She aims to provide good education to her children and for that she wants to save money from her business profit. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for their support.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for their existing grocery store.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a woman from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with seven children, ages one to fifteen. She and her husband have been engaged in fishing for five years now. They work hard because this is their only livelihood. 

Emelia is asking for a loan to buy an engine for her fishing boat. A new engine will ensure that they can fish on a daily basis without much trouble, thus increasing their productivity. She will use her profits for the family's daily consumption, to pay school fees, and to reinvest in her fishing business. 

In the future, she hope to have another fishing boat to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks for her retail ready-to-wear clothing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her 9 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

Elma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Elma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 27-year-old woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marites has operated a retail spice business in the Philippines for three years. She has requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Joelisa

texts.en:
Joelisa is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Joelisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her general store.

Joelisa has been sustaining her business activities through her ten prior loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children (a daughter and two sons).  They live in the village of Purba Shantinagar in Alipurduar district of west Bengal.  One of their children works as an electrician and other two are students in grade 12 and graduation level. 

Champa runs her own sewing business to help the family financially.  She makes ladies' garments such as frocks, salwar-suits, petticoats, blouses and other garments and sells these in her neighborhood. Her husband works in a small village hotel and his income is scanty. So Champa’s sewing work plays a vital role for the family. She works from home with great enthusiasm to provide more income and is helping the family to meet their needs. 

At present, she needs to replace her sewing machine because it’s got old and damaged by using it so much through the years.  So she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a new modern sewing machine. 

Champa would like to purchase some sewing materials also for her work so that she can stitch more clothing. She hopes the loan will help to increase her profit and allow her to work more effectively and efficiently. 

Her dream is to provide higher and good quality education to her children, so that they can establish themselves in future. Her future plan is to buy a piece of agricultural land with the profits from her business.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new modern sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc. for fishing.

Judith has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc. for fishing

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 39 years old and married with two children, both of whom are currently in school. Cheryl works very hard to provide for the family.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, and detergent soap. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

For 10 years, Ave has operated a retail personal care products business in the Philippines. Ave has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory of underwear, body lotion, perfume, wallets, beauty soap, beauty kits, and other personal care products.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines. Gemma has been in this business for 12 years now.

Gemma has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a 41-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For three years, Chona has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, and other materials for her business.

Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Budi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Budi, one of Ruma’s agents. Budi is a young man who lives in South Bogor, a village area located about one hour and thirty minutes' drive from Jakarta. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma last year and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to become an entrepreneur, as well as to increase his revenue and savings so someday he can continue to expand his business in another sector. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile airtime provider. 

As the business grows, Budi needs additional capital so he is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Budi's goal  in the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for lower communities, Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Budi is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping village community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 28 years old and has four children who are in school.

Carmelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries. Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. Emily has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bianita

texts.en:
Bianita is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school.

Bianita is in the agriculture business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Bianita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds, and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Bianita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is 57 years old Andes married. She has ten children, three of which are in school.

Rufa is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rufa requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rufa has been farming sugarcane for twenty years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rufa would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is 48 years old and married with five children. With three of her children in school, Ida works very hard to provide for the family.

Ida runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for nine years. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Ida would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 55-year-old married woman with two children, who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For 30 years, Antonia has operated a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: El Rostro De Dios Group

texts.es: Tres jóvenes emprendedoras constituyen el grupo “El Rostro de Dios”.  La coordinadora es Yorleni de 28 años, soltera, tiene su negocio de ventas de accesorios para celulares. Este negocio lo inicio desde hace 5 años con ayuda que su mama quien le presto dinero, su papa le ayuda en la venta del negocio y con el crédito comprara carcasas, protectores, cargadores y lámparas para ofrecer a su clientela. Las demás integrantes son Lourdes de 31 años y Paubla de 23 años, ambas se dedican a la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: Three young entrepreneurs make up the "El Rostro de Dios" group. The coordinator is Yorleni, 28 years old, single. She has her business selling cellphone accessories. She started this business 5 years ago with the help of her mother, who lent her money. Her father helps her in selling of the business. With the loan, she will buy housings, cases, chargers and lamps to offer to her clientele. The other members are Lourdes, 31 years and Paubla, 23 years. Both work selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy shells, cases, chargers and lamps.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old with six children, one of whom is in school. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

For 10 years, Adelaida has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Adelaida would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 45-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Aida has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Aida has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gerondia

texts.en:
Gerondia is 52 years old and married with three children.

Gerondia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gerondia has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Gerondia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store
